text: Came here cause my husband and I were hungry and it was late. Got treated not so good by our server. Will definitely not com back to this location again. Don't know if it was because we are gay or if she was just having a bad shift but we didn't feel good about our experience.

Dined here 3 times for breakfast. First time to try out the newest breakfast-serving restaurant in the neighborhood. The next two times, were only for convenience purposes. Probably won't try this location again. 
Coffee- not very good
Service - friendly. Inaccurate once, and a longer than average wait another time. 
Most likely some opening kinks and wrinkles that need to be ironed out. Nice design, decor and convenient. Big menu, full bar, with dessert and pastries.

Norma Jean is the best waitress of all time!!! She was very nice and pleasant.  She made us feel comfortable and helped us make our selection, which btw was spot on. 

I had the Chicken fried chicken (but grilled) and he had the Ham and cheese omelette. Man man man the food is to die for. Although I'm not a big eater and I'm very particular when it comes to food. I must say EVERYTHING WAS FANTASTIC; the Service, the food and the atmosphere!!! Did I mention the pancakes were unbelievable!! The best I've ever had. I'm looking forward to my next visit!
Tammy Sue, awesome girl, very friendly, great customer service, and hard working!! We will be back
The staff was pleasant but the food was unfortunately terrible! I ordered corn beef n hash and it was from a can!  The pancakes were very chewy!
Had the Dixie Meatloaf.  Very good.  Mrs. Borger had the chicken fried steak.  That I would give it a Borger star rating of 5 out of 5. Coffee is very good and service very good.

Service was great, coffee great,  breakfast was solid,  and location was easy to find. Menu selection was a bit bloated. Way too many choices. Normally with a menu of this size, quality will drop. Not in the case of this restaurant.  Well done!

Went two days in a row. The first day was disappointing. I got the steak omelet, hash browns and toast. Something was off with the seasoning. The steak was poor quality and the hash browns had a greening hue to them. I went back to try the honey coconut chicken and waffles which many had recommended on yelp. It was good but the chicken could use a bit more seasoning.
Food is delicious! Portions are big. Everything about this place is amazing. It really looks and taste like everything is freshly made.

Well, my experience was a little different from my friend Will M. I was actually provided with clean glasses lol and the food, was pretty damn good. I ordered the Steak Fajitas with veggies. I came in at 8am maybe that's why I had a different experience Will? lol anyways, I'll be back here when I'm being lazy to cook. 

If I have to compare this place to Black Bear Diner, BBD wins, hands down. blueberry Hill happens to be around the corner of my Apt lol I can literally walk there.

Always wanted to try this resto since it's near our place. Got so disappointed! Got Chili Cheeseburger - taste of the chili's the worst! Too dry, doesn't even taste like a chili. Honey Coconut Salad - can't even find a single coconut in there, just a breaded chicken. Nachos were dry as well, little sauce.

This place is great for late night dining when you can't decide what you want. They have everything! So many choices and desserts! Cakes and pies! Our server was very friendly and sociable she even hooked us up with some free pie :) try the blueberry muffin its delicious and comes free with breakfast

Had the Dowhome Dixie Meatloaf...more than I could ask for! Meatloaf was seasoned perfectly and placed on a open faced grilled biscuit and covered with sausage gravy and two slices of bacon with homemade mashed potatoes and mixed vegetables. Fast and friendly service!

I am very disappointed in the service here and especially with the customer service. We went on Saturday January 15 and we had a party of 5. From the time we walked in, we felt an unwelcoming feeling.  Plenty of the waiters and persons working in that late morning/ afternoon shift were very unpleasant. Our waiter was Tammy and she was by far the worst waiter I ever came across in my life. She wasn't welcoming. Her attitude came off as she didn't even want to be there at work. We were very polite and she still was cold and mean. She was very aggressive with her responses. We ordered a omelette and it came half cooked. When I mentioned it to Tammy she rudely said " What do you want me to do with it?"  and rolled her eyes.I was startled with that response. I felt very insulted and I had to tell her three times to take it back. I told her to please take it back and bring me a menu. Grabbed the plate and ran off with it. She never brought back the menu. Since she never brought the menu I requested to just make eggs and some bacon. She comes back with it and slams it on the table and walks off. She never came back and asked if the food was okay and if there was something else we needed. We were low on water, juices and she never came back. Then she comes with the checks and slams it on the table in between the  menus and said "Here you go, Bye." There were five separate checks and we couldn't even read who's bill was what. She didn't even have the courtesy to hand out our separate checks. We had to ask another waiter what was the process of paying because she never came back. We then saw her and told her if we can have boxes. My friend was trying to ask  her something as well and she just walked away. We had to ask another waiter to bring what we needed.  Tammy was very disappointing and I will never recommend anyone to this location and to deal with the horrible customer service that we went through. At this point we felt enough was enough and told Tammy to bring her manger to speak with us. The manager then comes and she was very nice and was able to help with the situation.
I would only go here for the pie. The coconut cream pie is delicious!! I would imagine that all the other pies are just as good.

The food was alright, eggs not cooked all the way but biscuits and gravy was great., however the service was terrible with late food and drinks halfway through the meal, wrong drinks. I would never come to this place again thanks to the service.

Came here with high hopes.  My pregnant wife was craving pork chops. After reading reviews of best pork chops in Las Vegas it was decided blueberry hill was the place to go. 
It's a nice family restaurant with the expected atmosphere. The wait staff was very nice. Back to the pork chops, they are offered two different ways. You get two when you order and since my wife didn't know Erich way would taste best she asked if she could get one of both. We were told they normally don't do that, but since it was slow she would ask. The waitress didn't come back so we assumed it was ok. Our food came out and there we two of the breaded pork chops. That's when we were told that they wouldn't do one of each. That's understandable, but it would have been nice if she would have asked my wife which way she preferred them. The pork chops were bland and unevenly cooked. She had to douse the potatoes and gravy on top of the chops just to get them down. Sad to say they didn't hit the spot. 
I ordered the Oreo chocolate pancakes that were VERY rich and sweet. I enjoyed what I could. 
There were other service issues, however, the waitress seemed to know we weren't satisfied and tried to make up for it the best she could. 
Bottomline, the service was pretty good, meat portions not so much.

Loved this place. Everything is home made and created to order. I had an incredible omelette. 
The server said the pancakes were the best so we ordered that too.  Bomb. Will definitely be coming back.

Granted it was Sunday 11am....and they were slammed...... however I would be willing to wait for an extra 5 or 10 minutes for the food to be cooked as ordered.  Everone in our group received eggs over easy versus over medium, regular fries instead of curly, well done instead of medium rare....you get the picture.  It appeared there were others around us experiencing the same.

Despite it all the food was delicious!

We will be back...even with today's experience they really are a great place to eat!!
Another great Breakfast. Portions are huge! Order breakfast, it's enough for lunch and dinner

Just ate Eggs Benedict. It was delicious. Service was efficient and courteous. Great value. Half the price of 
breakfast at a hotel. Restaurant was very bright and clean.
Excellent place to grab some breakfast. The service was overall phenomenal! Food was good and would definitely go back.

Not sure what happened with the staff here but completely different from our last experiences. Had to wait almost 10 minutes to order to go. Tried to order desserts and the server/host said he could only take 2 items at one time for the order. So we had to wait for two items to be sliced  and boxed up before we could order the next. Would have definitely ordered more had it not been for the rude/slow service. Wish I could I say I'd come back but not worth the trouble. We used to love this place.

Just got home with our five different desserts and let me tell you I've never had to chew so hard on a piece of cake/cheesecake. So disappointed.

Hello.

Thank you for letting me write an review for this restraunt. Here is how I judge my reviews off of each restaruant I visit.
Example Layout:
 Cleanness Of the Restruant
 Quality Of the food
 Pricing
 Service
 Speed

Now, at my visit, I ordered the double trouble cheeseburger.
Rating: 
Reason: The things I like about this restaruant are how comfortable the seating is as it is relaxing and has some leather back cushions. Both the Cleanness of the restaruant and service I like because once you have been seated, they offer you drinks and the menu has the pricing. Now the pricing is not a star because the sandwiches are at least 9.00 to 12.00 which doesn't include tax and as for this is why I  give it a .5 star. Now for the speed, it all depends on how much people are currently in the restaruant. I am currently in the restaruant and have gotten my meal within 15 mins of waiting. So for that I rate a full star for the speed. The Quality of the food is amazing, not burnt and ready to eat. So overall this restaurant 4.5 review, but since the site woulsnt let me do a half star, ill jsut bump this to a 5 star review!Thanks for having me!
It's like every day we are town visiting we have to have breakfast here. Mmmmmm #goodfood #getinmybelly #shouldawornsweats.

Warning! You need to make space in your belly! My fiancé and I know better than to indulge in late night meals, but when we do, we do it at Blueberry Hill. Particularly the Flamingo and Decatur location. Not all of the staff is great, but we can name a few that definitely make the experience way better! The bussers work their tails off, Martin you are awesome! And Norma, Chelsea, and Marvi, you are the few waitresses that place cannot do without! The food is good, but the people can really make or break the business. We love their homemade soups, chicken noodle and the meatball soup are the best! Their chicken parmesan is a classic, but I enjoy the crispy chicken without the sauce, the sauce can be a bit bland to those who eat without salt, but im sure if you add a dash it might be better. Regardless, I always enjoy the dish. Their honey coconut chicken is a must! And so are their pancakes!!! And their french toast too! You must try them with a side of ice cream! Yum!!! The only downside to eating here is the "itis" at the end...the "food coma," if you must...but definitely worth it.

Food is always great quality and a wide variety menu. I've never had to wait long for my meal. Today I had chicken fajitas for under ten dollars and a large portion size. The waitress was attentive and provided great service. Love this place.

Horrible, like the Walmart of diners.  Took 8 minutes to clear a space at the bar, which was pretty much empty. 20 minutes to bring out a very mediocre omelette Amazingly disinterested female bartender.. And the Mimosa at 7 bucks are horrible, no taste and no zip.  NOT a good deal, when las Vegas is full of cool restaurants to choose from.  Avoid at all cost
Best pancakes! This place is a great off the strip breakfast joint! Service was great and was seated quickly! excellent!
I went here once on vacation and loved the decor, but hated the service.  Super slow don't check on you but food was good.
Just here for the weekend with friends and we stopped by for breakfast.  Great service and amazing food!!!!!  Will definitely come back!!!

The place was very clean and comfortable. The coffee was pretty good too. The wait staff was courteous. I had ordered an omelet with corned beef and hash. The omelet was a little undercooked and the home fries were not home fries to me. They were strands of potato as if the potato was peeled. Strange and they were burnt. When I went to leave. My party and I were in a hurry and the gentleman at the cash register must have been doing a drawer change and said that he would be 3 minutes. Uh.. We didn't have 3 minutes so we just left more than enough money and left. 
They would have gotten 5 stars if the food was better and the service at check out was more prompt.

My parents ate at blueberry hill frequently when they lived in Vegas. 
Hubby & I are here on business/pleasure  for a few days and this is definitely where we will have breakfast every day. 
Chicken & waffles.....OMG yuummm!! 
Tomorrow I'm trying the Irish eggs Benedict. I can hardly wait.

Worst service on the cash register ( paula) .
never ignor a customer who is trying to make a payment. Nearly an hour wait for our food to get served, with a waitress who doesnt smile, and then cash register clerk with no feel for help. How about some ackowledgement ? Maybe ? No? 

Food is good place is good. 
But not again !!
Excellent pancakes and the selection is HUGE! Couldn't decide what I wanted it all looked so good!

Great family feel restaurant. The food is about $8-$13 for a meal. We went for breakfast and loved it! I had the Oreo pancakes which were delicious but a little too sweet for breakfast. Fast service and our server Nix was amazing. Super nice and always kept our drinks full. Great experience and would go back!

FOOD IS AMAZING. They have a large menu and let you make substitutions on just about anything! We almost always order breakfast though! Very generous portions as well! Open 24/7 with all day breakfast ! Wait time on weekend mornings is reasonable - your not waiting there forever and the staff is quick moving to get people seated. 

BUT - here is their down fall - the staff is always miserable. EVERY time we have been here our waitress looks like she hates her life. They are helpful and normally on the ball service wise but they are just absolutely miserable - not a single crack of a smile! Its a shame because the restaurant itself is a cute little place!

The restaurant is great. The food is as well.The Manager Steve is very thoughtful and cares about his customers.  I  had a horrible experience with the grub hub delivery driver. He was rude and not professional at all. Horrible service.  Steve went out of his way to solve the issue and to make sure that me and my daughter were taken care of. He was very professional and understanding.  Las Vegas needs more managers like Steve.

Went for a late breakfast on a Monday. I got the breakfast with the burger and potato pancakes. My daughter pancakes with eggs, sausage. I was hesitant to go because of the  bad reviews, but it's just across the street. We were seated promptly and got our drinks soon after. The menu is a bit extensive.  So many choices.  After ordering we didn't  wait long. They brought the wrong  order. (A little confused because the orders were somewhat similar). A few minutes later we rec'd the correct meal. The servings are hearty and the eggs were perfect. The potato pancakes were actually pancakes with shredded potatoes cooked in. Different, but I liked it. My daughter loved the pancakes. Big and fluffy. The food was good  and except the earlier glitch, the service excellent.  We'll be returning.

My experience today sucked. After we got seated we waited for 1/2 hour & nobody showed up to take our order, then were taking orders & serving people all around us, so I finally told my husband we are leaving, so we left. I will never go back to that place.

I just moved here to Vegas from Chicago where these type of places are all over the city. Its taken me about 8 months to finally find a pancake house that has decent pancakes. We came on a Sunday at noon and probably the worst time you can go to a family restaurant. We waited about 20 min. We got our table and served drinks within 3 mins. The menu is hugh! Don't really know if I would eat anything but breakfast here but we ordered the country breakfast and the pancakes were great. They were hot, large, and great taste. We just got regular ones too. I can only imagine how the speciality ones taste. The eggs, bacon, and rest of the food was great. The service was good for being a packed house with others waiting outside. We came at their busiest time and I can say that it's been the best so far in this town of excesses. Without going on the strip and paying through the nose on atmostphere instead of quality, this is the best. Great Job Blueberry Hill. We will be back often.

Blueberry hill never disappoints if you are hungry and you can eat like a beast this is the place to come too cuz their portions are big. I come here once every year when we are in town we love it. The place is clean and spacious We never waited in line their service is great and the staff are friendly. Can't wait to be back.

Really bad experience at this location today. We frequent their other locations with awesome service and food . Went for breakfast before catching a flight out. Service was very slow and order arrived cold and incorrect. They took the orders off the check but we really hadn't eaten so we ordered some pancakes which never came out after 20 minutes of waiting. So we left - couldn't miss our flight. I believe server was new as was the cook and the manager was vaguely apologetic. This place needs help!! Horrible way to start the morning!
Great selection of everything but breakfast menu is the best. Excellent customer service.
Yummy- extended breakfast hours!  They have a monte Cristo sandwich- which is a rare treat for those who love them!

The food here is good. Sadly with the kind of service they have here it drags down the food with it and makes it not worth it. It's hard to get refills and twice having asked for a salad it does not come until our food arrives. Like I said the food is good but the service desperately needs some work.
Wonderful breakfast!  We split the dealer crapes with fresh fruit and it was great.  Went went back 2 times!  Laurel was our server and she is terrific- so friendly and attentive.  Highly recommend.

Definitely a change of pace here compared to the strip. Tired of the same thing over and over again on the strip I took the time to look up something that was more like home. Stumbled upon Blueberry Hill and decided this was the spot. I was extremely surprised at what they had to offer. They have a huge no frills menu. Food is good and cheap, and they provide excellent service. Service was a big plus here, they  will actually speak to you and wait you unlike the service you receive on the strip. Will definitely make a stop here everytime I am in Vegas.
Quick walk to this place from Palms. Definitely comes in handy walking afterwards due to amount of food. Great breakfast! Highly recommend!

Really good breakfast this morning. Very quick service for a big party this morning. Our server was very nice and was very on point. The sourdough toast was one of my favorite things. My husband had the grilled pork chops and eggs and he loved them. The hash browns weren't our favorite, but the home fries were very tasty. We haven't been to a Blueberry Hill in many years, but we can't wait to come back again!!
Love the Honey coconut chicken and waffles and the Mexican hash. I visited this place twice while staying in Vegas. I'll be back for one of those delicious looking cakes

The pork chops I got definetly weren't grilled fresh, they were just reheated . The sauce on them was too much,  like trying to hide the taste of the meet , hide the fact meet wasn't tasting fresh . Inexpensive place with Mediocre food

The people (at least the ones I follow - Jessica, Josh and Cesar) are still there and still excellent.  The food preparation has taken a hit recently; it's not as good as it used to be (seems like the cook staff is getting lazy), and the management is just plain apathetic.

The last three times the Orchid and I were in this place, there was one or more annoying, abrasive or just plain rude party making everyone else's lives miserable.  Now, we are aware that the trend in service management these days is to ignore the jerks and make the polite people bear it or leave.  We have in the past made comment to the management staff concerning the screeching children, the loud-to-the-point-of-pain raucous laughter, and the foul language of certain parties.  My mother, the most honorable Mama Hawk, and the politest person I know, attempted to light-heeartedly bring to the attention of the mother of the screeching child that he was causing the patrons around them to not enjoy their meal; this woman started screaming at my 88-year-old mother, complete with a litany of her "right" to eat wherever she pleased, and threats to my mother's health and well-being.  When management was notified of this incident, it was suggested that WE leave, as if we had been the offending party.

Jessica, Josh and Cesar - you've always been great, and we will miss you.
Sylvia (management staff) - your attmept to insert yourself into the conversation I had with the other member of staff was unwelcome.  You don't know our family's history with the Blueberry Hill organization, nor do you know what really transpired the last three times we patronized your restaurant.  (For that matter, you don't know anything about the eight years we've done business with the Hill.)  You are not entitled to an opinion, and anything you attempted to say was unwelcome, unqualified, and, frankly, irrelevant.
Male member of management staff (I think your name is "Steve:"  I thank you for listening to our complaint this time, but your droopy, three-quarters-asleep eyes gave me the impressuion that you were either too tired to be on duty or that you really didn't care what we thought.

So ... this will be the last time we patronize Blueberry Hill.  One star because Yelp says I can't give a zero but that's how I count it), and one for the three memebers of wait staff who do a wonderful job in spite of the environment they are forced to work in.

On the Nighthawk 100-point scale: 15 ... five points for each of three wonderful servers.

My favorite breakfast spot in Vegas when it comes to hotcakes! Have tried the oreo cookie pancakes and the blueberry are the best!! Cant go wrong with original pancakes either!! Steak and eggs was just ok...

Love, love the bluberry crepes. The have a great deal with a ham steak and eggs of your choice and two good size crepes with fruit for about 13 dollars. Also amazing customer service from the waitress, super friendly.

Here visiting from Atlanta and wanted something outside of The Strip. Drove pass this 24 hour location and it was worth the stop.

I ordered the mushroom & cheese omelet with pancakes. I was not disappointed. The omelet came with three pancakes, and they were huge!

The omelet was fluffy, very cheesy and didn't even need added seasoning.

OMG, these pancakes were heaven sent. Light, fluffy, REAL butter, and did I say huge!

I would definitely recommend this location if you have a vehicle. If not, it's accessible by public transportation or cab. 

They make their own desserts and OMG!!!!!! If I had not gotten pancakes, I definitely would have gotten a slice of cake. Many options for those with a late night, early morning, or anytime sweet tooth.

This is THE place to have breakfast in Las Vegas! Right down the road from the Palms Hotel. We're sorry we didn't find this place on our first day, we would have been here every morning for breakfast. The portions are huge! My husband is a big guy with a big appetite, and he could not finish his meal. We both had the ham and cheese omelette with a side of pancakes. The ham tasted like fresh baked ham, not restaurant supply ham. We took the extra pancakes back to our room and noshed on them the following day, they were still just as tasty as the first day and even tasted good cold! Our waitress was on the ball, I wish I got her name because I would give her a special shout out for being so great.  When she packed up our leftovers, She even offered to put my husbands beverage in a to-go cup~! I'm going to look and see if this restaurant chain is in New Jersey~ I cant wait until our next trip to Vegas to eat here again.

Katy was our server and was sat with four tables in about 3 minutes. She still provided excellent service to all of us. Thanks, Katy! I had chicken fajitas and my husband had a chicken club. Both tasted great and were more than we could eat. Other than the bathroom looking pretty yucky and being out of tp, it was a great experience.

Some of the best food in Vegas. We had an amazing breakfast at a reasonable price, with great/quick service. We would absolutely come back here! The Guadalajara breakfast skillet was the best skillet I have had in a long time and the hand made sweets were delicious!

This place is excellent! The food was delicious and it was reasonably priced. You get a lot of food for your money too. This was a great find outside of the strip and plan to return. Our waitress Alee was such a warm and funny person who really took care of us.

Even in vegas its a struggle to find a relaxing place to eat around midnight. This atmosphere looks awesome! Nice decor, friendly staff, and I ordered a chimichanga for $11 and an Irish coffee. I've heard about these chains before but never stepped inside one. For a chain/franchise this is actually not bad. 

The downside, super long wait, the waiter felt bad and made me another Irish coffee.
The night cooks need some training from the other Blueberry Hill down the road. Just saying. The waitress was good though.

I love this new location so much 
The only reason I don't like the location on decatur and Charleston is that the workers there are always in a rush and don't really care about there job. At this new location the workers there are super nice and look clean (if that makes any sense). I never know what to order so I asked the waiter what she recommends i only knew I wasn't pancakes and she suggested the potato pancakes. My first thought is yea sure lets see how this goes. My mother always orders the same thing fresh fruit creeps . 

When my order came the pancakes look like hash brown. I knew I was going to like it because I love anything made with potato. But these pancakes where amazing. I tried it with Apple sauce and cream cheese. But I enjoyed it with maple syrup. It's like hash brown but sweeter. I will order only this from now on. 

I love the cleanliness of the  restaurant And how it looks and feel like a house . The pies look amazing in the entrance.

Thank you! Perfect brunch spot for locals and tourists!

This was a perfect redemption meal from the awful service and food at Sinatra at Encore (10x the cost) the night before.

For the two of us, we had under a 10 minute wait on Saturday at 11:30am.

Comfortable seating. Great layout. Very friendly, but clean and unique layout of the restaraunt.
Immediately knew that if the found was even half-decent, we would become regulars here.

Sure enough the service was on-point. Wait staff was on their game. The food (Pro-tip: honey coconut chicken waffle) was a winner. Great food, easy in & out. Well priced. The dinner menu looks great too, and I wouldn't mind trying it out sometime if in the area. Didn't get to try out the desserts this time but that looks worthwile too.

Thank you! We will be back and we will be bringing (lots) of family and friends with us!

WORST breakfast ever!!! TV dinner tastes better than this crap! Its so obvious that nothing is cooked or "home made" here. Just reheated out of a bag or can kind of food. Everything came out cold & bland. Perfectly cut square potatoes they just put into the microwave & watered down drinks. SO disappointed!!!

This was the best breakfast that I've had in a restaurant in a long time.  The place is spotless, superb service!  I had the Irish Eggs Benedict, absolutely perfectly cooked!  My husband had the pork chops and eggs, so much food cooked perfectly.  His pancakes were amazingly fluffy!
Very clean, excellent food and the service is fast.  We came for breakfast 4 days in a row.  Way above the competition.

First time at this location.  Enjoyed the laid back diner atmosphere.  Quick service and tasty food.  We had salads and soup....but the BBQ rib special looked pretty darn good

One suggestion would be to include some No Sugar Added desserts along with the selection of cakes and pies.

Food was pretty good but the service I received was horrible server was not clear with my order and did not verify my order when placed it so I received something I changed my mind on reason for 3 stars. Bad first experience

We left the Orleans hotel to grab breakfast here. Just about a 5 minute drive from the hotel. Plenty of parking on a Monday morning. We walked in and seated immediately at a large booth. Restaurant was very large inside. I was fooled frim the outside. The decor is nice. It looks like they may have recently remodeled. TVs hanging everywhere as well. 

This spot was like denny's on steroids. The popular dishes are the waffles with chicken tenders in top. I went with the chicken apple compote waffle. For $11, it was definitely a lot of food. The apple compote is house made. Not too sweet. Chicken was okay with it. I felt it could have used a bit more seasoning. The waffle was good. It did get a little soggy but it was expected with the compote. I ordered one biscuit and gravy a la carte, $4. I thought it was good. They take a large biscuit and slightly toast it and slather it with their gravy. 

Kids were happy with their pancakes. No complaints there. Plenty of food and drinks to go around at the table. Coffee was regularly served. 

They did take a long time to bring us the check. I had to get up and ask for it. We paid  $63 for 3 adults and 2 kids. Not a bad deal. I would eat here again. Stop by the dessert counter and check out all those confectionary works of art.

Hands down, THE BEST breakfast restaurant out there. I haven't tried the lunch or dinner, but the breakfast is BOMB. It is a MUST when we're in town. The pancakes are the best I've ever had. Thank you, Blueberry Hill.

This is an amazing place for breakfast! Heard great things about it so decided to try out. It's huge inside, was packed on a Saturday morning. We got seated immediately. Service is very efficient, got water and coffee right away and it was refilled very quickly. 
Now the yummm part. Have to admit, the BEST WAFFLES AND PANCAKES. Waffle is crisped to perfection and their home made butter on top... mmmmmm.. pancakes are so fluffy and flavorful. They make it look real fun for kids, my kids pancake pic attached :) When was the last time you had a great side of toast at a breakfast place? I can't praise their toast enough lol, perfect temperature, so buttery and crisp! My kids even raved about how good the bacon and sausage was. 
Highly recommend, this is going to be our new fav bfast place. They serve lunch and dinner too.

Came in on a friday, looked busy but were seated within 5min..Got waffles with eggs n bacon.(waffels were really good the bavon looked alittle burnt) husband got patty melt(really good)..restaurant was clean service was quick..only complaint was they had the show forensic file on the tv and they were discussion kids getting murder n wife getting rapped (my son was reading the screen had to tell him to turn around)..wasnt the best channel choice

My weakness  When visiting Las Vegas "Blueberry Hill" is a must. I've never had the best tasting "french toast" and "blueberry compote" ever!!! Everything is made from scratch daily including the thick slices of baked bread. This french toast reigns superior along with its ingredients. #madefreshdaily #madefromscratch

We went here for a friends birthday, per her request.  It was my first time here.  We walked in, and were seated quickly.  Our server was fun, and pleasant.  Got everything right.  The food was pretty good.  It hit the spot.  I had soup and chili, and it was pretty good.  Birthday girl had pancakes, and the other one got ham, and eggs. 

The restaurant was clean, service was good.  It seemed popular as almost ever seat was filled.  I'm sure we'll be returning.  It's definitely worth a try if you're looking for a breakfast with a large menu, and good service.

Ate here a few hours ago as I wanted to try this location for the first time since I'm used to the Charleston and Decatur location which I frequent when I can. Anyhow my first impression is this location is alot bigger then the other location and I love the design they also have alot more to add on the menu compared to the other location as for the food it was just as good as the other location same big portions for the same exact price the only negative was the potatoes some were cooked the others were real raw to the point where I couldn't eat anymore but that's my only grip with the food as it was delicious I'm still full and this was about 10:30 am and now it's 1:24 pm lol. As for the service it was so so the lady didn't check on me as much as she did and she didn't offer me a knife fork or spoon she was nice but I just wish she checked on me more then she did other then that with those major gripes I think I might come back here again.

I've been going to the Blueberry Hill on Charleston and Decatur for more than a decade, so I was very happy when this Flamingo location opened because it's much closer to my house. I've been to this location 3 times, and I always order either the Classic Eggs Benedict or the Alaskan Waffle. Both are absolutely delicious and this new location carry out same great flavors. 

The reason I gave this location 2-star is due to their customer service. All three times I've been here, I've had to wait at least couple minutes for someone to greet me when I walk in the door. During my most recent visit, I was with a party of 5 and we got seated at a booth with no menus, no servers in sight, and no busser to serve us water. We waited about 15 minutes to get our iced waters. And then waited approximately another 5-10 minutes for a server to come and take our order. I understand that it was a busy day (Saturday morning), perhaps the hostess shouldn't have sat us until the server was ready to serve another table? 

I probably won't be coming back to this location, I am willing to drive to the location on Charleston and Decatur for a better dining experience.
Great food and great service! Loved it. My friend was visiting from California. He loved it too~

Super disappointed in my breakfast this am : (. I ordered the eggs Benedict. I admit, I'm really picky about how my eggs are cooked. I especially don't enjoy when they are overcooked, and this is exactly what happened. I basically was served hard boiled eggs covered in hollandaise sauce (the sauce was delicious). There is just no excuse for this. Yes, I could have sent them back, but my boyfriend already had his food, so I didn't want to wait. He loved his food by the way. He had the pork chops. We also shared a side of biscuits and gravy and a pancake, all tasty. Not sure if I'd go back though. Service was just ok. Coffee was lukewarm at best and I didn't get a water refill.

Overall, the food was descent for the price. Our waiter, Caesar, was very kind and attentive. The table and menu were sticky (syrup). The syrup vessel was covered in sticky syrup (hadn't been cleaned off in a while).The cakes and pies on display were beautiful.

If you are on a budget, this is the place to go (more for your money). Great place for large groups as well.

We stopped here the first morning as soon as we arrived in Las Vegas. We were all excited to try it based off of the reviews and photos. The service here was...eh. Our waitress was a little rude. My food didn't look the same as the photo. I ordered French toast. I absolutely hate whipped cream and in the pic there isn't whipped cream but there was on my order. I know its not a big deal but it was annoying and wrong.

My family (wife and 2 kids) come to the location on west flamingo about 2-3 times a month. We like to do dinner because the place is pretty quiet snd very relaxed.  There truly is something for everyone.  Service is always great, food is awesome and the deserts are soooo good.

Large, clean new location- they have the same menu and massive portions as the other locations, but I felt the staff was a little less friendly, lacked the character found at other locations. 

The breakfast offerings are reliably good, but I usually only come here for desserts: the fresh fruit crepes with just strawberries and powdered sugar, no whip or cheese, are the best. Light, fluffy crepes packed with tons of fresh strawberries- super healthy, shareable portion, about $12.

I've been coming to Blueberry Hills for a while now and decided to check out this new location last month. Ive been back 7 times since! The food is always delicious and the pancakes and crepes have never failed me. They have a bakery in the store too and bake their desserts fresh every day. We normally come in the mornings, service can be a little slow at times but never horrible. The staff is fun and quirky, I always hear a waitress laughing with their tables. Nix is one of my favorites, she is always upbeat and cheerful and makes me leave in a good mood after a big breakfast.

     We decided to stop by for dinner this week for the first time to check it out. It was extremely busy and I was a little dissapointed we couldn't sit in our normal spot. Our server was Josh, he was very attentive and informative on their massive 16 page menu. He knew the prices on everything we asked off the top of his head , and let us know how we could save on some money by deluxing our pancakes and meals(we added it up and we saved $13.78!!). Our side salads came out quickly and we were offered dinner rolls AND corn bread (I had no idea they had these?!). The food took almost 40mins to arrive after placing our order but it came out pipin hot and everything was delicious. Our server checked in on us twice after we started eating but I noticed the poor boy(looked 18) was practically jogging taking orders, serving food, making salads, seating people, working the register, and carrying plates of food all over the store. I got the feeling the store was under staffed... I only saw 4 employees with the store fully packed. 

    Overall I would have to say I love the place. Its by no means the best place out there but it's definitely worth checking out. Great food, good prices, and a hard working staff is all I can ask for

After having so-so experiences at two other Blueberry Hill locations, I decided to give this new one a try, mainly because it's conveniently only a few blocks from home. I was impressed by the new style of the interior, much more modern than the other ones. Unfortunately that's where my being impressed stopped.

We seated ourselves and were attended to quickly enough. Our server, whose name escapes me now, wasn't really rude, just kinda snippy with us when we asked questions, like if I could have my burger with no onions. She said it doesn't come with onions and they had to be requested, and I pointed out the top of the burger page where it very clearly says that the burgers come "dressed with lettuce, tomato, grilled or raw onions and pickle", and she insisted I was reading it wrong and seemed to speak to me like I was a dummy. Whatever, I worked all night and I'm not looking for a debate for my breakfast/dinner, I just want to eat. We settled on the breakfast of champions: two orders of bacon cheeseburger & fries. As I sat waiting for my food, I noticed that my fork was pretty dirty. I really didn't want to be "that guy" and gripe about a dirty fork, especially because I wasn't going to use it anyway, so I cleaned it with a napkin and put it back. The server brought out our drinks and two glasses of water. 

When the meals came out, I was really expecting more. For $9.59 I got a medium size burger on a slightly hard bun, and what seemed to be a handful of fries. On the side were 3 sad-looking pickle chips - I guess a whole pickle, or at least a lengthwise slice, would be too extravagant. Having dealt with BH before, I knew better than to ask for some cole slaw, because that's going on the bill. The food tasted good enough, but I really cannot justify paying almost $10 for a skimpy plate of mediocre food.

What really ruined the experience for me was when I finished my iced tea, and went to drink the glass of water. My glass, which I hadn't really paid any mind to until then, was filthy. Hopefully it wasn't dirt, just residue from their dish detergent, but I still wouldn't want to drink from it, even with a straw. By this time I was truly over BH, and still wasn't feeling like arguing, so we paid the tab and left. I mentioned to the cashier about the glass while we paid and she went in the kitchen and scolded someone as we were walking out the door.

Like the saying goes, you never get a second chance to make a first impression, so I can now say that I'm truly done with Blueberry Hill - if you need me, I'll be at the Black Bear stuffing myself on huge, worth-the-price portions and dealing with friendly people.

The outside of this building is really plain and boring and I wouldn't have given this place much thought if I wasn't always near it. Much nicer on the inside than expected. 

I ordered the Chicken Waffles to go. The chicken was ... there. Barely. But the waffles were really good!
Love this place, reminds me of norms in California. Just don't order scrambled eggs, they taste like fish.
Our waitress Nix was so much fun! She knew the menu so well! She made the meal a 5 star experience!

I always come to this location. When I have family in town I also bring them here. It's close to the strip and easy for people to find. I like this location because it's clean and there's friendly staff. They have great food at affordable prices. They also offer take out, which I do all the time! I usually don't come here for breakfast because that's when they are busy! Busy busy place for breakfast, but worth the wait.

I went for dessert and a milk shake,food was 100% however the reason  for 1 star was the server(#8)he was just plain STUPID he repeated my order twice and got it wrong,finally after going over each word he got it.Not very complicated pie & ice cream and a malted milk shake,he was very RUDE I asked for the check and I asked him to take it to the cashier and he refused,he said I had to do it myself,although I have other servers do it for me (handicapped) he finally snatched the credit card(roughly) out of my hand and returned with it and threw it on the table.(what tip LOL)and for this reason 1 star and never to return.I have been there many times and had a perfect time,great servers and food a little high priced but quality and quantity is more than justified.
Good breakfast, especially their waffles and French toast.  Pancakes are light and fluffy.  Service is prompt. Seating is comfortable.

Just a few minutes off the main drag lies a hidden gem of a restaurant known as Blueberry Hill. And it's damn delicious. I love the cozy vibe inside this place. It's like a diner ate another diner and created this place. Loads of seating. We got in for brunch on a Saturday with no wait at around noon. WINNER.

The menu is ridiculous. And by that I mean ridiculously GOOD. I love options, especially when they're all within the same style of cooking (i.e. they don't overreach). This place delivers a ton of variations of classic American diner dishes that make my mouth water. 

POTATO PANCAKE EGGS BENEDICT. If you are in any way a lover of poached eggs in hollandaise sauce, this is it, man. I misread the description and assumed that the English muffin was replaced by the potato pancake, but you get BOTH. Carbs upon carbs upon carbs to wash away my bad decisions. Or maybe yours. I don't really drink. But this is the ultimate hangover cure. That hollandaise sauce is bomb. Perfectly poached eggs. Potato pancake that makes my Jewy heart sing. English muffin lost in all the madness, but swimming in yolk and sauce and deliciousness. Oh yeah, and there was fruit somewhere on the side. I left a very clean plate that would make my grandmother proud. 

And of course I tried all my friends' plates; isn't that normal? 

Fries and ranch: what the fuck is in this crack ranch?! IT'S SO GOOD. I didn't even need the fries so much as my finger, but let's face it, I'm a somewhat classy lady. I couldn't do that. Not with so many occupied tables nearby. -_-

Biscuits and Gravy: ENORMOUS portion! Enough to feed a linebacker. Biscuits so fluffy, I could sleep on them. Gravy so divine, I felt like I was in the south. 

Chocolate chip pancakes: one of the lesser indulgences on their sweet menu, but my friend didn't leave a bite on that plate. Plus points for serving sugar-free maple syrup so he could pretend like he wasn't one step closer to full-blown Diabetes for polishing off that meal. 

Service was so excellent. Our server, whose name I have now forgotten since it's been a few weeks, was on top of his game. Super friendly. Chatted with us about lots of random stuff. The meal was very reasonably-priced and I left feeling like I had made the best decision of our whole trip by coming here. What  can I say? I love food.

My only thought once we drove away was: "WHY DIDN'T WE GET PIE?!?!"

Great spot for breakfast and more.  Very extensive menu.  Nice location in the SW and close to the strip but with somewhat limited parking.  Sunday's can be really busy but as of yet when this review is written  and while this location is rather new, the weekdays are not that busy.
This place reminded me of diners and family restaurants up in the Chicagoland area where I used to live.  It really had that big city vibe on that Sunday I went.  The countertop  seating  not facing the kitchen was a nice touch and is good for a solo dining experience and to do some B.S ing with the staff.

Had the vegetarian omelette which was fluffy, big and and tasty with 3 homemade pancakes as a side which were also fluffy and good.  The waitress was on top of it and often offered refills for the coffee.  
Here what their site says:

"All our Beef is U.S.D.A. Certified Choice Beef
Our Coffee is 100% Columbian, not a blend
Our Eggs are Certified by the U.S.D.A as Grade AA, the highest in the industry for quality and safety, and are size extra-large.
Fresh Blueberries
Our Bacon and Sausage are 100% Oscar Mayer.
Our orange juice is 100% pure juice, no water, no preservatives, never frozen, not from concentrate.
All our fruit compotes are homemade in our kitchens, not from the can. Every fruit compote will be served with slices of fresh fruit on top. Strawberries when out of season will be frozen".

Next got try some of their coconut honey battered dishes.  Its sound great.

Waited 20 minutes and had no one attend us on a Thursday after being seated.. I know you guys aren't that busy on a Thursday from the look of it. Oh, but a bigger group comes in after us and you guys are quick to attend them... just saying. And we aren't the only ones who weren't being serviced.  Everyone is running around wiping tables like they have a line of people waiting for a table...there wasn't. Look I work in customer service and the way the waitresses have no idea who has been served and who hasn't is sad and unprofessional. Sorry to say that you guys lost a few customers.

Just moved to Vegas. Been here few times. Today 9 of us went in for breakfast and Cesar was our server. A friend mentioned it was me/my partner's 27th anniversary and Cesar was extremely amazing and kind. He was so respectful and really embraced that it was our anniversary. That says a lot in today's world. I wish more people could be like Cesar. Not to mention the level of service he provides to the guests. Thank you Cesar.

This place was so good we tried the coconut chicken and waffles, corn cakes, and the mexican style breakfast with fried eggs. Everything was good! I loved the waffle and chicken but you won't like it if you aren't into super sweet candy like chicken haha. The chips get a little soggy under everything in the mexi breakfast but everything was tasty. Server was very friendly and brought drink refills. Very busy popular spot.

I've been coming to Blueberry Hill for 27 years, and this location keeps the tradition alive! Delicious fresh food from scratch, a huge menu accommodating to any persons taste or craving for that day, and their orange cake is to DIE FOR. If you're there at night, ask for Rachael. She's the sweetest!
Great service!  Extensive menu that far exceeds most diners. Excellent food. We will be back again during our Vegas stay

Great food, everything looks so yummy and everything tasted delicious! I will be returning time after time to try everything on their menu! Oh and the service, super friendly, great at advising/suggesting (they know there menu well), and very fun. This is truly a nice family experience in some really great food and service.

Very nice place. So busy but,very attentive to the customers. The Manager was not afraid of work. He was there right with his staff working.
Food was excellent. Good size meals. Many choices to choose from.  I would live to see more restaurants ran this way.

Love love everything about this restaurant! Lovely decor and staff! 

Pro: 

We were seated pretty fast in which we thought this place would be packed like other breakfast spots but this is a total gem! 

They have a bar set up where you can eat as well with huge screen tvs! 

The food and wait time was great! Food was sooo delicious and flavorful! Came hungry and left full!

Good home cooked meals, with deals! Had the Dixie meatloaf with mashed potatos, sans the country gravy, and instead added the brown gravy. Overall it was very tasty, but it was a huge portion, could have split the meal in half. The dinner came with salad, soup or chili. And you can have cornbread for the asking. I ordered Blueberry pie to go. Very satisfied again with Blueberry Hill.
It's pretty good, but also pretty expensive. I recommend ihop or baby stacks. Don't recommend if ur a vegetarian because it's really expensive.
A great place for breakfast! Loved that it was buzzing with people & they show the football games on Sundays.
Another location, another great breakfast. Some of the tastiest corn beef hash I've had.

Our waitress Lily was amazing. The food was excellent. By far the best dining experience of our whole trip. We did the whole buffet thing...it's ok. We ended up going back to blueberry hill for lunch and were ecstatic to see lily again. I can't stress enough what a great place and experience this was. We will always come back! Thanks again lily...you are awesome!!!

The food was delicious and came out pretty fast. I had the chicken and waffles with apple compote and almost fell asleep after eating it. It was so worth it though! The service wasn't the best but the place is always packed. I highly recommend it!

There was a lot of people when we arrived and were told the wait would be 15-20 mins, it was about 15 mins when they called us. The servers are friendly and the service was pretty fast, the food was super good! We will definitely be coming back on our next visit.

Okay well this was my first time coming here but my friend recommended it. I guess the place looked really big and the cakes and bakery in the front all looked really pretty and even the menu was really big and had so many items to choose from. The lady that was serving us was really nice and the place played really hip music but only issue.. I don't think place is really clean at all! Like our table was a little dirty the lady forgot all our silverware (we had to go take silverware from another table) I ordered the chicken Parmesan because the waitress said that that was her favorite .. And when I got my food omg it looked absolutely NOTHING like the picture in the menu ): it looked like a giant SLOP on my plate like something you'd be served as a school lunch but probably worse.. the picture showed that there would be broccoli but the plate had a whole pile of corn BLECH! so I told the lady I expected something like the broccoli from the picture and she said she'd give me a side dish of veggies so I got broccoli, cauliflower and carrots (that was a bit better)  then halfway dining I see this GIANT COCKROACH ON THE GROUND WALKING TOWARDS ME OMG. I absolutely HATE roaches and seeing one in the place I am dining in made me lose my appetite real fast and that thing ran right under me too *cries* this place just disgusts me , I'm only giving this place a 1 star because first I can't give 0 stars and second the lady was actually kinda nice so 1 star goes to the waitress but I recommend not coming here the place is dirty and food isn't made to perfection not very quality food if you ask me

After searching hi and low (I asked a local where to get good local breakfast).  He said, "Blueberry Hill."

So my colleauge joined me and off we went and called Uber.  In 20 minutes, we got to Blueberry, sat down and ordered a nice homemade meal. I'd have to say their chicken waffles was really good.  Chicken was very crunchy and moist. Even their black coffee was not too bad (and for being a coffee connoisseur, you get my drift).  Overall, service was excellent, our waiter (he must have been with Blueberry Hills for quite a while) because he had a lot of stories about Vegas oh years ago!!  I think before I was even born!!  Hahahah :p  By the way, that was the highlight of our visit.  He was such a cool guy!  We would come back just for his stories and his great optimism of life!

Until then, be kind to one another and Cheers! ~ :p

Our host was Steve & our server was Marvi & this was such a great place to eat, all the comforts of home & Marvi took care of our every want with a smile. The food was so delicious, I know I'll return to eat the & soon, thanks for a great 1st experience

I think this has now become a place for my SO and I to snag breakfast in Vegas.  We initially found it because we walked over when staying at the Palms, and it's not a far drive from the strip.  They have a big selection here.  I keep coming back to the various chicken and waffles options that they have.  If you're in Vegas and don't want to wait for breakfast on the strip, definitely check this place out.

I love breakfast food more than anything else, and this place delivered. It was also nice to get off the strip and into a bit of "normal" Vegas. I ordered a fairly simple breakfast of biscuits and gravy, bacon, eggs, and two pancakes. The food was excellent, and the service was attentive. My only know is the price, nearly $3 for each pancake? Let's bring that down a bit.

Stopped by on a Monday morning, place wasn't busy at all and I was seated right away. My server was Nix and she was super friendly. I ordered the honey coconut chicken and waffles and some shredded hash browns. The portions were very generous and food came fast and hot.  The waffles were big & fluffy with just the right crunch. Hash browns were cooked good. The chicken is chicken breast vs bone in pieces which I think would work better but it was tasty. The coconut flavor wasn't overpowering which I liked because I'm not a big fan of coconut. They have a big menu, all I looked at were breakfast items. I'll definitely come back to try some other stuff.
Poached eggs were cooked properly, coffee was decent. They really need to work on their potatoes: flavorless, greasy & cold. Gravy was room temp. Think I'll stick to Black Bear Diner down the road.

Service is always very good, but last night at 10p it was just bad. Walked in to be seated, waited at the sign and the 3 waitresses working were all behind the counter talking to each other and 1 was even sitting down. After about a minute standing there with them looking at me, one said to the other "go seat them" and just walked off by me. Time to pay and the same 3 at the counter talking to each other and 1 sitting down. 1 at the register but she ignored me and said to another after 30 seconds of me standing there looking at her "he needs to pay".
It will be quite awhile before going back

Food was delicious. Wife had the breakfast tacos with chorizo instead of taco meat with a pancake. I had the waitress special, 3 strips of bacon, 2 xlarge eggs, and a Belgian waffle.  My wife and I both agree that the griddle items were the best we have ever had! Everything was better than average. While the food was very good, the service was less than average and nothing to write home about. They filled the glass with ice so you could get three sips of water and you had an empty glass, THEN, it say empty for 15 minutes. It may have just been our server. She seemed a little scattered, writing down the table number wrong on the ticket so the food was almost delivered to the wrong table, and forgetting what our drinks were not even two minutes after she asked us. A disappointing way to bring down a restaurant's rating when their food was damn good! SMH.
I was worried with the star rating however. It was really delicious. My taco salad was great.  The waitress was nice. I was actually pretty happy with it all.

I really want to give 4 stars for the big portions and yummy food but I came in drunk at 3 am and really wanted to enjoy my meal in peace without talking to anyone since I came in alone. Luckily, I was feeling like a happy drunk that night, but my server was testing my patience. As I waited for my food he talked to me and made it clear that he thinks I'm attractive but said nothing rude or offensive but clearly I'm like half his age. Then the food comes out and I'm ready to grub. He leaves for a second, comes back then says "I'm your server so you don't have to be embarrassed of stuffing your face in front of me." Then he goes off about Adam and Eve and his theory behind it. First off, I came to the place to eat, not to be social especially when I'm exhausted. Second, religion is the last thing I want to talk about. Third, I like taking my time to enjoy my meal rather than stuffing my face so I can get you to leave me alone and stop talking. I have never once had a server talk to me during my whole meal. I think I just felt too hungry to give a shit about telling him off. I literally kept nodding my head the whole time as I'm stuffing huge bites in my mouth. Oh and after he tells me his theory, I have one bite left and he says "You can tell me if I'm talking too much." And starts laughing like it's funny. I'm not sure if that's just the way he serves people by making conversation or if he was just trying that hard to get my attention. I was just bored and uninterested I'm sorry to say. I swear I'm not a mean person but damn, that was annoying.

Sometimes you just want pancakes for dinner, and Blueberry Hill has always served me well, whereas the offerings at most other 24/7 breakfast joints haven't quite done that. I've long been a fan of the fruit compote pancakes, and the pancakes here are always absolutely massive, around 7" dia. Fluffy, not needlessly sweet on their own, and superb with blueberries baked inside.

Understandably, mileage may vary, but I can't recall having a bad experience with the service here.

This place used to be a Marie Callender's, so rather than the neon blue glow that is characteristic of the other Blueberry Hill restaurants, you'll find that the country home aesthetic still remains.

I was going to give this place 3 stars because service sucked. We got a lady who didn't smile, took her sweet time and was just not friendly at all.  But we got our order in and when we got out food everything was delicious.

Great food, very 
fast and taste 
Nice workers .
Spaghetti was good nice taste best water

Friendly, prompt service and great food! I recommend the bacon cheeseburger...MMMM! And for the record the patty isn't made until you order it! I had a little bit of the Denver skillet also, so good! The fries were ok, but I can look past that!
The blueberry pancakes were very good my girlfriend said there was something off about her eggs Benedict   Very good Service. Kinda pricey

Initially I visit the other location on flamingo.
This one was  okay.
As you walk in you can tell this is a newer location.
Since I had already visited another location the other location and had a positive experience I really thought it would be the same. Sadly it was not.
The service was really slow and even the food was not the same quality.
For being a chain restaurant you would think at least their food would've the same.
Awesome place ! Came in for breakfast not knowing where we were going we are vacationing in Vegas from Miami.  Excellent service and very clean.  Ask to be seated Nix she is GREAT.  Enjoy !!!

The food was great and our server was bubbly and enjoyable. The woman who seated us, however, was very flat and seated us at a dirty table. It had been bused but the seats had crumbs in them and the table had syrup and water dripped all over it. She saw us talking about the dirty table and came back by and asked what was wrong. We showed her the drips and she said "oh, that's just water". We had to show her that it was sticky and she said "ok I'll wipe it down". Granted, she did come back and wipe the table down, but I still ate my breakfast with someone else's crumbs in my seat. Call me old fashioned, but if a customer points out the table being dirty, it shouldn't matter if it's water or not. In the service industry, you should just clean it up with no argument and not try to excuse the table being dirty.
Huge portions & not expensive at all. Really yummy. So many things to choose from and fast & friendly service.

My friend and I walked in at 11am on Sunday 11/22/15 and were seated right away in a big comfy booth. This surprised me though because there were plenty of people waiting in the lobby, but I can only assume they were larger parties.

Blueberry Hill has one of the LARGEST menu's I have ever seen. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner and are open 24/7. The breakfast menu alone is around 4 pages long. I am the most indecisive person, so it took me some time to figure out what I wanted. I finally decided to get the chicken fried steak which comes with hash browns, eggs and toast. My friend got the Irish eggs benedict. Our server was nice but I didn't even get her name. She just kinda wandered by and took our order. Someone else brought us our coffee and water. I am not complaining, just saying that it felt a lot more informal than I am used to at most restaurants.

The food came out quickly and everything was delicious. I really enjoyed the chicken fried steak, and the gravy that came on top was really good. This place is also a bakery, and they have delicious cakes and pies for sale.

Las Vegas' Blueberry Hill Restaurants have been around since the 80s and we finally got around to having a taste. Conveniently open 24/7 the restaurants are a great fit for every mood and occasion; all-day breakfast, lunch, late night specials (aka drunk food), and all-American comfort food.  

Some of the other locations are old and run down, but this "new-ish" location is well kept and modern while keeping its warm diner-esque feel. Late night specials for $5.99 are offered from 11pm-7am, daily specials are affordable at $7.99 a plate. 

We were two of four customers early this morning, waitress Nix took care of all of us. Great customer service! Very attentive and friendly. She seemed to get along really well with the other patrons. That small-town restaurant banter is hard to find in this city. 

We look forward to dining here again.

i just received my order.  one order was completely wrong, scrambled eggs insread of over easy.  no butter for pancakes, no cream or sugar for coffee.  they are less than 1/2 a mile from where i live, yet they couldn't or wouldn't make this right.   i called grub hub and they told me i would have to place another order to get a driver to bring the items.  thats a $10 minimum, plus a $3 delivery charge to get cream and sugar and a replacement meal.  while they did credit these items (taking over 20 minutes on the phone with with grub hub) i still have a meal that no one here will eat and coffee thats being poured down the sink. me, members of my church and friends go here often because its close to the house.  collectively, we spend at least $350 a month, but never again.  the big bear restaurant at trop and jones has reopened, and we will "vote" with our pocketbooks and wallets.  blueberry hill will never see our faces again.  thanks for the credit.  i still have hungry people here.  who's gonna fix that?

We are from Hawaii and decided to try this place which I googled and was pleasantly surprised how good the employees and the food are.  Friendly employees and efficient too.  Food didn't  take long to come.  They never wasted time to refill our coffee and to take away our plates which was done to keep the table clean.  As we say in Hawaii, Mahalo (thank you) for making our day.
Great place for breakfast! I enjoyed my feta-spinach omelette with French toasts! Servers are very friendly. Loved the atmosphere and food!
Great food. Excellent service. If you're ever there after hours, ask for Don, a great bartender.
This place had some of the best pumpkin pancakes ever! The eggs were a little under cooked and the hashbrowns looked gross. The coconut chicken and waffles were tasty!

Don was our server.  The was much better than our last visit. I had the chicken cutlet with spinach Alfredo.  The chicken was great the Alfredo yummy.  The service and good was 100 percent better than last visit.

Although the restaurant was very clean with decent service, it was very pricey for some mediocre food and bland hot chocolate.
We and a couple of friends ordered the three fruit crepes with warm compote, chicken fettuccine, and chicken fried steak. 

Crepes- Weren't too satisfied with the artificial flavored syrup and coloring.

Chicken Fettuccine- Chicken was lacking seasoning, not very tasteful.

We don't believe we would return back here in the near future.
Always  great food. Breakfast is the best. The pancakes are yummy  and their Mexican plates are so good
Great food. Fast service. The coffee is very good. Enjoyed out breakfast. Will make it a regular stop on our Vegas vacations

Seriously, I don't think they care that the service here is bad- or rather non existent. 

When we came in for brunch, we had to wait a few minutes to be seated, which was no big deal. However, after we were seated and received our menus, no one spoke to us for 20 minutes. Nobody asked if we'd like drinks, servers passed us without even acknowledging us. 

Right when we got up to leave, someone asked if we'd like drinks, it was too late. We were too pissed and hungry to deal with it. 

Then the hostess said sorry and held the door open as we left.

Came here early in the morning 5 am ish after a night of balls to the wall fun & mischief, which shockingly always seems to leave me much poorer, but at least not in jail thank the Lord!

At the very least, I will have great stories to tell in 40 years to regale my future geriatric friends and Grandkids in the Nursing Home before I join the great mischief maker and Chief in the Sky...

But now the Food!!!

I ordered the combo with steak, eggs and pancakes and a piece of apple pie from the best waitress this side of Heaven! If she hadn't been married and me being marriage adverse...I would of proposed on the spot and gone to visit Elvis downtown. She knew how to make a Man happy!

I really enjoyed the Steak, it was covered with grilled onions it was tender easy to cut and chew and packed with flavor. I had the scrambled Eggs they were fine as well...I didn't have any more room for the Pancakes and they did look dead sexy at the time.

The waitress said they are the best pancakes in Vegas, I will have to take her word on that because heating them up 24 hours later in the Microwave they were well...not so great.

The Dutch Apple Pie slice, she recommended to me as I was paying my bill was fanlickentastic. I want to go back an order a full pie ASAP! 
 
As the King would say, "Gimme some Sugar Baby"

I actually came here back in April when my Mom was in town for my birthday. I live a few blocks from here but had never given it a try. We went in for breakfast on a Saturday around 9 in the morning, and the place had a really nice diner vibe with lots of people and great smelling food in the air. We were seated in a booth almost immediately, and had a really nice waitress who had the diner customer service (sassy :D)attitude down. We were very amused with her throughout our meal, and she answered all our menu questions with expertise. I got a blueberry muffin, still warm out of the oven, and a bacon salsa omelette thing that I can't remember the name of. Both were delicious. My mom got pancakes, and definitely bit off more than she could chew as the portions here are huge. The coffee was also quite good. 

We liked it so much that we went back for breakfast on Monday around 7 before Mom flew out, and it was just a good of food. It was a different vibe as we were one of three parties in the place, but the waitress did a great job of making sure all were attended to and had plenty of coffee. 

This place is definitely going to be a tradition when I have family visit in town, and I'm happy I found a nice laid back diner that I can take people to. Keep up the great work!

I recommend anything with bacon!

I had the waffles and eggs, the waitress breakfast, and the waffle was crisp, eggs were done perfectly and we all left satisfied. The service was nice but the time it takes to get food may put some people off but we were fine

Excellent.

I found this place in a CBS radio list of great 24-hour diners in Las Vegas (24-hour in Vegas is easy. Great 24-hour is not) and it certainly measured up. After perusing the multi-page menu I decided on breakfast. The waitress accepted my substitution with a smile (four sausage instead of two sausage, two bacon) and although it took a while to come it did not disappoint. Well-done eggs, sausage as requested, solid fluffy pancakes with heft and flavor. 

Service top notch, food as well. Worth a return trip and seeing as they're open 24 hours, they'll be ready when I come back.
Great place for savings and support to others. This is a good deal

Portions! So much food! We had the Honey Coconut Chicken Waffles and Cinnamon Swirl Pancakes with HOMEMADE ICING with a side of potato pancakes/bacon/eggs for breakfast. Love at first sight and to the last bite!
Breakfast was good I wouldn't say it's the best place to have breakfast but it was okay food. I wouldn't think I would stop by again but it was worth a try.

I am a little torn, the service was a little hit and miss, or maybe it was my server.  I didn't get what I ordered or how I ordered it, I asked to have one poached egg added to one of the quarters of my chicken and waffles, it came without it, and after I asked her she brought one poached egg in a cup full of water, I tried to scoop it to put in on top of my chicken because I didn't want all that water on my dish but I was impossible, it ended up bursting in the water.  The manager noticed and immediately told her to bring me a new dish.  My husband was almost done with his breakfast by then.  My new dish came but my mimosa failed to come until the end of my meal.  The food is ok, some items like my husband's are pretty good, but I guess service depends on who you get.

My family and I were tired of paying for expensive breakfast on the strip (we stayed at Bally's). The prices were not worth the food quality. So when we were leaving to head back home, we asked one of the valet attendant where can we find good breakfast. He directed us to this place. GREAT CHOICE!!! And not to mention the prices are very reasonable! The menu had so many choices to choose from and they are open 24/7. Great service, I loved our waitress! I will definitely be coming back to this place.

Good family restaurant, I had egg, cheese and ham omelet it was very good, pancakes had a great flavor to it, and omg the coffee was spot on! The hash browns were not that good but with salt and ketchup it was better. I recommend this place, fast friendly service with no waiting. Girlfriend had sweet banana pancakes and she loved them. We shared our plates as the amount of food they serve is awesome.

Do not order from here. I wanted a piece of cake. I'm in from out of town, no car, and my accommodations don't have a restaurant. So I used GrubHub. To get to the minimum delivery amount, I also ordered meatloaf, which came with a side; I chose chili. The order arrived. I got back to my room and there is no cake, the only thing I wanted. 

I called the restaurant and Autumn tells me that she's absolutely sure that she packed the cake. I call the driver who says the woman didn't go over the order with her the way she usually does to ensure everything is there. I do the live chat with @Grubhub and they offered $3 for the cake. 

After talking to the driver, I called the restaurant again. Autumn answers the phone and, lo and behold, her story has changed. Somehow, there were TWO orders at the same time of meatloaf with a side of chili and chocolate cake. What are the odds?! And because the restaurant was so busy, she put the chocolate cake in with the other order. Never an apology, never a "we'll get this right," just a "we were really busy and I put the cake in the other bag." 

Interestingly, when GrubHub called me, the guy said Autumn told him that SHE wasn't the one who packed my order. It was now "the new girl" who doesn't know the difference between one container and two. The solution offered by the restaurant is that I could come in and get the cake THEY forgot to pack. Now... if I had wanted to go to a restaurant, why would I have used GrubHub in the first place? I'd spend more on a cab than the cake was worth.

I tried one bite of the meatloaf and it was dry and flavorless. Had I been in the restaurant, I would have sent it back. It was inedible. There are hundreds of restaurant in Las Vegas. Avoid this one.

Who doesn't love an all day breakfast spot. Was in Vegas for a music festival and crawled out of bed around 2pm and drove here.

My usual go to at Blueberry HIll is the french toast combo. It comes with two slices of delicious french toast, two eggs and hashbrowns. This is all for under $10! 

Their pancakes are also great. Love the apple cinnamon compote pancakes or fresh strawberry pancakes.

Service is great. 

Definitely come by if you don't want to get ripped off by Strip pricing.

WHOA. Where have I been? Like what planet have I been living on? Lol. Okay, so maybe my taste buds are feeling some type of way right now because I've seen the reviews and not many people have enjoyed this place BUT I feel it's one of those gems that are a little underrated. Maybe it's just me?

I too was a little skeptical. I wanted mashed potatoes or just an All American type of meal. My BF had tried it many years ago (lol, palm to forehead!) okay babe, Let's give it a go. 

Exterior looks a little dated and interior looks like the outside...dated but in a weird way, I dig it! It was clean and well kept.

So I saw our waitress take pancakes to another table and I told my BF that we needed to order pancakes because they were HUGGGE and Fluffy!!! Dripping with that yummy strawberry compote and whipped cream. Let me tell you, they were worth every bite! 

Our server was sweet and welcoming. She was knowledgeable on the menu items and also letting us know about portion sizes as well. I ordered the chicken noodle to start. Very hearty! Full of chunky veggies, chicken and noodles. I also ordered the Honey Coconut Chicken which came with mashed potatoes and steamed veggies (broccoli and carrots, yum, my favorite!) My Bf ordered the special which was meat loaf topped with red sauce, fettuccine and a garlic bread. He said it was very good and really liked the fettuccine, it was simple and tasted homie. And to share, we got the Fresh Strawberry Pancakes topped w/ strawberries, whipped cream and strawberry compote.

Everything we had was splendid! Definitely give them a try at this location.
Loved this place! I recommend the cheese and ham omelette with their chunky potatoes. Those things were awesome. This is definitely the breakfast place to go to while your in Vegas.

Came to other locations with great service .  The service at this location was not up to standards , the server seemed annoyed right away of our party of ten . Had to ask for refills , some items were never even brought back out. The server never asked how our food was.  We had a problem with one of our meals and she never offered to have it fixed or an alternative she just said well that's how it was . We felt rushed and a bother the whole time . Next time we will go to another location.

A group of us came in here for dinner and I will tell you, the service was absolutely horrible. It took so long to get drinks ordered and then our food ordered. On top of that some of our food didn't even come out right, like we had ordered it, so we had to wait even longer. They never came back with my lemons for my water. It took asking three different servers until we got what we asked for. I used to come to Blueberry Hill all the time when I was younger, but now, the food isn't as good and the service was really bad. I'm not surprised with how many people were actually dining there when we were there. None of the food was fantastic, mediocre at best. Our waitress didn't even seem like she wanted to be there. Everytime we asked her something, she didn't really have a direct answer for us. This location is definitely one that I don't care to go back to anytime soon.
Had the Mexican Pepper steak it was soooo good , the portions are so big service was great  we was a party of 4 food came out quickly , breakfast an lunch an dinner anytime

Huge menu selection. The restaurant looks great - the remodel served them well. It's super clean. 
My parents enjoyed their liver and onions and roast beef sandwhich. I ordered a grilled cheese that came out a little cold, while my fries were piping hot. 
Service was good. Will return soon!

Food was great I give it an 8 . The reason for my low star rating is the service.
