The server we had took 20 minutes to take our order then brought out our food and had us wait another 5 minutes for our toast, didn't check on our drinks and when she did ask she never brought me more coffee, at the end I asked for a water and that took another 5 minutes. It was the server we had because before then my bf asked for another OJ and the server who we asked brought it immediately. I am not one to review places with bad feedback but I found it really annoying. Oh and let me say it was not busy at all she was in charge of 3 tables then at the end 4 .

Sitting here waiting for our food. 
We've been here since 11:30 it's now 12:50 still have not received it. 
Asked the waitress what was going on she gave us the run around saying that they were still waiting for it to come out. 
I spoke to the manager Steve he said he apologized for the inconvenience that there had been some sort of confusion in the kitchen but apparently no one could clarify what the confusion was. 
Our original waitress was Chelsea and the one came to explain everything was named Felicia she said that Chelsea didn't even want to come out for being so embarrassed. The manager Steve only offered to cut the bill in half which honestly was not good enough for me. 
It's one thing to mess up but it's another to let your customers sit there without explanation.
I'm sure If we hadn't complained they woulda let us sit there longer. 

This was my first and last visit to the restaurant.
The food was good when we finally got it but we didn't even get to enjoy it because our experience had already been ruined.
Poor service. The moment we walked in the hostess said "itll be a while". What an odd thing to say to someone walking in to the restaurant. We did wait a while. Then finally left.

The disaster started before we even walked in the door. We couldn't figure out where the entrance was due to no signage. We tried three different doors until we figured it out. We were seated within ten minutes even with it being moderately busy. After we were seated someone asked if we would like coffee and we put our cups out and only one was poured and the lady simply walked away with no explanation and did not let us order our daughters drink. Once the waiter, Cesar, came over he explained it was brewing which was completely fine with us. We ordered around 12:20 and then didn't get our food until almost one. The ticket time was way over what it should have been, and then we got our food and didn't even get all that we had ordered. We were missing a plate of pancakes but no one ever came by to check on us so I had to get up from the table and go find another server to bring the rest of the food as well as syrup we had requested before we ate. When our waiter found out we were missing food he brought out the pancakes and said "they were not ready that's why I didn't bring them out". It was extremely rude and he never once apologized or checked on us. Luckily the manager was willing to discount some of our food. If Cesar would have just apologized and checked on us, this would have never happened. I'm a server myself so I'm very patient but this was completely unacceptable and rude. We would have even ordered dessert if we would have been treated well!!! Unfortunately I will not be returning because of the awful service. The only reason that I give two stars is because the food was decent and the manager did discount our bill for the service and timing.

My fiancé and I tried to make a pick up order. The lady who answered the phone was named ASHLEY was EXTREMELY RUDE. She gave us attitude during the entire call, when we asked how long it would be before we could pick up she said "HOW ARE YOU PAYING" we said I'm sorry how long will it be and she yelled "HOW ARE YOU PAYING" we just gave her the credit card number and then she asked for the address, zip code, and a bunch of other strange extra information. Then she said the machine didn't work and asked for it again. We told her never mind and hung up. We order from blueberry hill every week and they have never asked us for any of these things besides the credit card. ASHLEY need to be spoken to as treating your customers horribly will make sure you have no customers. We love them so much especially the Marilyn parkway they are so amazing and kind. I will never call or go to this location again!!

I don't normally post Yelp reviews and when I do it's always positive.  I feel like I would be doing a disservice to Blueberry Hill and it's possible patrons if I don't post a review on my recent visit.  First and foremost....PLEASE REMOVE the turkey dinner from your menu!  I've only been to your restaurant a couple of times and ordered breakfast both times.  In addition in both cases I visited the Decatur/W Charleston location.  I wouldn't have anything negative to say about my two previous visits.  On my most recent visit my husband and I stopped for a quick dinner on our way to a concert.  I love to have a traditional turkey dinner and have ordered that item at other restaurants with great enjoyment.  However on this occasion it was a colossal mistake.  Let me start with the gravy that covered every inch of my plate, first of all it was clear!  It had a weird gelatinous consistency and absolutely no flavor, matter of fact the entire dish had no flavor at all, I had to add salt and pepper to everything.  The stuffing, if you can call it that, was basically soggy bread crumbs.  The turkey was piled high but I'd prefer quality over quantity, although very dry it was at least edible once I scraped the gravy off.  The mashed potatoes were also edible without the gravy.  The corn was definitely straight out of a can but it was really the only item on the plate that I ate almost entirely.  I only wish I had taken a picture for further proof of just how horrible this menu item was.  If there were such thing as zero stars that what I would have given.  I implore Blueberry Hill to either remove or revamp this menu item.  On a positive note the Oreo cookie cake was very good.  But Being that my husbands meal, although edible wasn't much better than mine we've both vowed to NEVER eat at Blueberry Hill again.

We have been to this restaurant now 4 times in two weeks, food selection ad taste is fantastic. The service is always great and place is clean, never a wait. A definite recommend for all, and we will continue to go !!!!

Late night just got off of work and we were hungry, so we stopped by this Blueberry Hill on the way home and because of Donald we will make this our new after work late night spot!!! His personality is infectious and he's real down to earth! His smile and small talk kept us awake and made us want to get to know him more. Thank you Donald for feeding us and keeping us awake we left happy and we will definitely be back weekly to see you! Lily you were awesome too! Thank you both so much!
Went to brunch here with my son and bestie! Food was amazing a fare in price for such great tasting food. It's like getting a fresh at home cooked meal without having to make it!!

I've gone to these restaurants for years all over town. This is the newest and my favorite location. They serve the best original pancakes in town. Nothing fancy or crazy or over the top. If you're looking for good old fashioned pancakes, this is the spot I'd recommend. The menu is extensive and broad. I've never tried anything but breakfast here, but I've also never tried anything I didn't like here either. I'm very surprised it's received a 3 star average.

OK this place is where the Marie Callenders used to be, it was vacant for a while then Blueberry Hill came in. I enjoy thier other Decatur location by 95 and the first time I came to this one the service and food wasn't up to par. 

I ordered thier Giant Baked Ham Sandwich and it was huge! The menu says a quarter pound but I honestly think there's more in this one. Comes with lettuce, tomato, mayo and your choice of bread. You can also have curly fries or regular fries with it. 

This sandwich was definitly satisfying, more than enough and very reasonable at $9.99, thier menu is huge! So much to choose from, definitly no shortage of options. I'm not much for breakfast so I'll eat lunch food in the morning if I'm out, and there is a ton of options if you don't want to just be limited to lunch food. 

The service was on point, never had to ask for a refill, very friendly and kept checking up on us. This experience was a lot better than last time, I always give places another chance. Sometimes it could just be a shitty day, this one not the case on this visit.

We linked up with my sisters childhood friend from New Jersey that now resides here in Vegas. So, after hanging out chillin in our room talking b.s. and drinking. We went out for a little walk around the new strip. After working up an appetite my sisters friend suggested for us to go here.

Now I'm the type of guy who couldn't pass up on a locals recommendation. I did the chorizo skillet which was definitely pretty good. It's too bad I had that nasty flu that was going around. You know the one that screwed with your taste buds, made you have no appetite what so ever.

Anyways, the service here was definitely pretty good. I think our server was one of two women who was doing the whole floor and she definitely kept up. Our waters and coffee were refilled and never did we ever have a long wait. Would definitely eat here again.

Thank you for reading my review. I hope this helps with your decision making experience. Enjoy your awesome yelptastic day!

What an awesome place to get some big portions of food! Derek, our server was so nice and gave us a really good customer service! Kudos to that! My boyfriend and I came in here and got the Steak Fajitas Omelette and Chicken Cutlets with Fettuccine Alfredo. Plus with the cornbread, Caesar salad, and Oreo Cake! Everything was so bomb! And yup, we will be back here!

This has to be one the of the best breakfast restaurant- very clean and superb choices. Pancakes are just from another universe!!! Server Wendy was very friendly as the other people were. I would definitely stop by few more times.

I heard great things about this place so I went and I was highly dissapointed. I ordered the eggs Benedict Florentine and they were the worst I ever had. The hollandaise sauce was flavorless, which makes up the dish. The English muffins were soggy. We also ordered a chicken omelette and the eggs were overcooked. How do you overcook eggs????

Besides for the food, there was an intoxicated patron inside laughing and being extremely loud. I would have expected an employee to tell him to keep it down or get him out. I'll give the restaurant the benefit of the doubt and say maybe I ordered the wrong plates. Highly disappointed tho.

It was really busy! We were helped right away and not too long after we checked in our table was ready. Our waitress was super nice but double charged us for a meal, they fixed it right away. Don't know if it was on purpose or if she was just too busy to notice her mistake. I'll give her the benefit of the doubt and say it was a mistake. Food was pretty good, I didn't even get pancakes so that's probably why it doesn't get five stars this time around. We will have to see how good they are.
Huge portions- tons of choices.  Great food and good service.  Prices pretty decent.  We'd return for sure.

Eh. Denny's down the street is way better. The menu is wayyyy too long. I got the corned beef hash omelet. Eggs aren't salted at all, the insides aren't that good tasting to be honest. It could've had more flavor. Small portion of alright hash browns. My roommate hated his burrito. He didn't enjoy it at all. My boyfriend loves his apple pancakes but when I had a bite, it was super starchy. For our food, it took forever. I understand that there were 4 of us but no on was ahead and it shouldn't have taken that long. The food isn't bad, but it's not good. I don't recommend this place.
Great service and huge portions. This would be 5 stars if the French toast lived up to the hype. Not nearly as thick and luscious as I expected. But the pancakes and everything else was wonderful.
This is the best. Josh is a great waiter my wife and I eat here 3 times a week. The management is great we moved and we still go eat their alot. I wish they had one in Silverado ranch.

Came across this amazing restaurant on our way home from my birthday vacation in Las Vegas. Honestly, I have not been able to find a breakfast dinner to have an enjoyable recipe of home style Crepes, but Blueberry Hill accomplished that. Our server was very attentive and friendly, price was affordable and overall service was amazing!(: Will revisit if ever in the area again!

Probably the worst corned beef hash skillet I've ever had. Sounded great but when it came out it was all potatoes and seriously about a two bites of corned beef. Server asked if everything was ok, I asked if that's normally the amount of corned beef, she says yeah and walks away knowing I'm obviously not happy.  Over all not a good experience.
This was a great place.  The atmosphere was nice, clean, friendly.  Food was great.  We had the corned beef hash eggs Benedict and french toast combo 2.  We will definitely be back.

I will start by staying this place has the best pancakes I have ever had. They put liquid crack in it. Lol. 

However, I CAN NOT stand the evening crew at this location. They are very rude, unprofessional, and slow. My honey and I like Blueberry late at night and every time we come in (anytime between 11-2) the male greeter/server who works that shift, ALWAYS tells us the reason they are slow is because of a cook shift change. So it takes 3 hours for a shift change? I don't think so!!! One horrible experience with him was, he had the nerve to write my order down incorrectly, so when I got home and realized I did not have my liquid crack, I had to drive all the way back. He had the nerve to come outside (as I'm re-waiting for my food) and argue with me about what I ordered. Ugh...he is the reason this location receives 2 stars. We do not eat it as often anymore because of him.

So,  the first time we dined at this Blueberry Hill our experience was OK. It was a Sunday afternoon. We were seated quickly,  service was OK, the restaurant was clean, food came out in a decent amount of time.  My daughter was happy with her chocolate chip pancakes,  boyfriend was satisfied with his steak and eggs, my "little boy blue" was meh. Portions were large,  prices are reasonably cheap,  flavor/seasoning was meh (my blueberry pancakes, while tasty on their own,  were smothered with an ample amount of blueberry goo... firm, almost hard, blueberries in a heavily corn starched "sauce").




The second time....

Again,  it was a Sunday. The lobby was full so we were expecting a half hour to 45 minute wait,  so imagine or surprise when the host informed us it was only going to be 10-15 minutes.  Score! We were seated in the allotted time,  however it took about 15 additional minutes for our server to greet us and another half hour for our order to reach the table.  

My daughter's medium steak came out very well done (dry with no pink). My over medium eggs came out sunny side up (I'm pregnant and "shouldn't" have eaten them but was starving at that point). Boyfriend's medium burger and over easy egg also came out disappointingly over done. Our friend's biscuits and gravy came out burnt? But as mentioned earlier,  we were super hungry/over it and didn't want to wait another hour for a refire... our server was nowhere to be found.  


To be fair,  we'll probably give this place another shot in a few months.   Until then,  we'll stick to our go-to weekend brunch spots with consistently awesome food,  consistently long wait times and consistent service (Mr. Mama's, Babystacks, and Eggworks).

The food was barely average and the customer service sub par. 

After ignoring me the hostess that "sat me" pointed in the direction of a table rather than actually seating me and my server was less than cordial and barely made eye contact. I felt rushed and ignored and had to wait for my bill. Overall it seems like the staff is pretty apathetic. 

The honey coconut chicken and waffles were dry and lacking flavor.

I was recently in Vegas for a car show and we needed something to eat that was close to where we were staying. We found Blueberry less than a mile away with lots of parking available. The restaurant was nice inside and larger than it appeared. There was a nice menu of mostly typical diner fare but that was exactly what we were looking for. Dinner was great, prices were very good and service was great. we liked it so much we ended up coming back for breakfast the next morning and loved it even more. Breakfast is definitely their strong suite and we enjoyed every bite, can't wait till next year, Aloha

Super friendly staff and the prices are reasonable for the ridiculous amount of food on your plate.  Thank you Chantal & Lilly for your awesome service! The pancakes are super soft and fluffy, the corned beef hash cooked till the edges were just crispy and the waffle was fluffy and slight sweet! We'll be back!

Really good service here. Staff is nice, food is great (there french toast is what love is made of...), and the facility is very clean.

Best part is that this location has a bar.
Just 10 minutes from the Flamingo. Great food. I'm taking the family there next time I'm in Vegas.
This is the place u definitely want to bring friends, family, and co-workers to! It's awesome!!!! I loved their wide variety of food and boy it was delicious!! Love it

I am giving this restaurant one star because of the customer service and quality of the food. Our server Donald was full of it. I order the chilaquiles (probably was my first mistake) as soon as I took a bite of the chips they were stale. The only thing that taste good to me was the eggs; I ask the waiter of I could remove the chilaquiles because the chips were too stale for me to eat. He proceeded to lie to me about the chips being freshly cut and pulled out a thermostat to prove to me that he checks the temperature of the chips that were served to me. I was taught the customer is always right; Donald proved to me that he is more concern  with being right then a repeat customer. On a good note my boyfriend loves his food. Only complaint he had was they do not offer alternatives for pork like turkey bacon or sausage.

My wife & I come here every time we come to Vegas which is a lot. Today may be the last time we come. The service here is horrible. Every time we come it takes longer and longer to get our food. I've been seated now for about 30 minutes. I have no food and haven't seen my waitress since she took our order. So over this place! The employees don't smile and walk around like they don't want to be here. This place needs better management. All the times we have come we see the General Manager in the front seating people or doing nothing. Smh!

I am a GrubHub driver who had a very nasty encounter with the manager, who later said he was the owner, of this location, Steve. Upon arriving to the restaurant, I checked in with them to let them know I was there to pick up. The person working the counter didn't ask who the order was for or anything, just said "oh it will be a few minutes." After waiting for over 30 minutes, I approached Steve at the hostess counter and confirmed he was the manager. After simply asking what was taking the order so long, he proceeded to be very rude and say things like "well I have over 100 customers in here right now" and "Maybe you shouldn't accept orders from us next time"and "Grubhub isn't the only delivery platform so I'll just cancel" I was trying to remain professional during this whole thing but Steve made it impossible to do so. What he should of said was "let me check on that for you." But no, instead Steve was very unprofessional. After I asked another employee if the order was done, he put his hands on my shoulders in an attempt to move me out of public eye and into the kitchen. After instructing Steve to not put his hands on me, I willingly moved into the kitchen to hopefully get an answer.  Steve then claims to be the owner of all Blueberry Hill locations all of sudden and brings the employee that supposedly takes the online orders into the situation and she proceeds to verbally attack me even though I never said a word to her. Come to find out, the customer's food had been sitting on the kitchen out window the whole time I was there from the beginning.

My family and I have been coming here for many many years. Every time we come, we request Maria to serve us. She's amazing and keeps us coming back!! The cooks make great food and cater to our personal requests and diet restrictions. Thanks guys :)

It was pretty crowded and the food was okay. I probably should have ordered something different because my plate wasn't very good. I had the blueberry hill scramble. The cheese they used in it would have been better if it was cheddar cheese. They used sliced sand which cheese. They did the same for the omelette my son ordered. He wasn't impressed either. The pancakes were good. Next time I'm in Vegas I will try them again to see if we just made poor ordering choices.

Service was slow, it  took forever to get the food and when it finally came out there was a moldy bun on my burger. when i pointed it out they offered to replace the bun. But its ok the moldy bun was only on top of the pattys they  must have forgotten about and thank you for the additonal charge for chilli that never made it on the burger.. maybe that would have covered up the mold and i wouldnt have noticed.when the waitress finally came around with the check and noticing i have not touched my meal it never occurred that maybe the mold they surved up might have had something to do with it. Thank you Blue Berry Hill for my first and last experience.

Great food,  they tried hard just seemed they were short staffed when we were present..
Thx Norma for the accommodation

Great oversized portions of home style food. Yes it cost more than a McNasty but it is real food and the taste will be worth it. Staff is always friendly and effective. I'm here for the food not the entertainment :)

This place is delicious ! We were visiting from out of town and ate here twice. Their cinnamon swirl pancakes are to die for ! Literally ! We also enjoyed the chicken and waffle dish. I would recommend place to anyone
Fun local chain in the Las Vegas area for breakfast!  Find one. Try it.  You'll like it!  :-)

food was ok....my pork chops were under cooked...make sure u let them know to cook well if your ordering pork chops and eggs...our waitress had a dry attitude...she hates her job..everyone else followed up with our driveway know refills...

Coffee not hot enough, we ordered waitress special and dealers special, we waited atleast 20 mins then our order was wrong and short! The bacon is not done enough the toast came with the dealers special was late!!!!

Went there for breakfast on 8/28/16 and 8/29/2016.

For breakfast that was pretty standard menu.

I would have given the place 3 stars, except of what happened on my first morning there. I was really looking forward for a breakfast burrito, and didn't see any on the menu. I asked the server about it and she said they could make me one. Yes!! Turns out it was exactly what I was looking for, it was great! I asked her why it's not on the menu and she said that it used to be but got removed at some point. She suggested I write a Yelp review to make the owners aware. So owners, you are now aware :)

I returned the next day and had the veggie omelet: it was good and crunchy from the brocoli and carrots. Wish it had more onion.

Service was exactly what I expected.
Went here for breakfast and enjoyed it pancakes were a little dry but nothing syrup can't fix. Good place for breakfast if your in the area.

Overall just okay. I have been here dozens of times because I live close. This location is on the corner of Flamingo and Decatur not to mistake for the other location on Decatur across from Wal-Mart. The menu is just silly, way to big and full of food I know they dont sell everyday. Why sell food items you hardly get orders for. They should refine the menu and throw out 75% and just fix the items that are okay. Everything is so bland, they do not flavor the vegetables at all and other things really lack flavor. Only things okay are breakfast items, waffles are good, biscuit and gravy okay. I never really get everything I want though because they are not very flexible, if you wanna make adjustments it might cost $3 when they shouldn't. Service is funny, most servers are just okay and no one works together. They should help each other, refill drinks, ask if everything's okay because your server might not come around. I have literally never got an egg order right though, they always under cook eggs even if told how the yoke is preferred so don't be picky. They hand write receipts and use a hand calculator so confusing what you paid. The menu is confusing, a lady expected hash browns at the other table but was basically told sorry learn to read, no attempt to make them happy. My over medium well eggs came out over read easy again, they didn't even try. Had to ask for refills twice. It's crazy how much this place could improve. The owners hopefully will take note and make adjustments but things have not changed at all since opening. I'll be back for late night wake waffles and will update with any changes. Enjoy

We have came here before and have had good experiences but today was not the case.  They sat us at a dirty table and it still had a tip.  We waited twenty minutes for service, the server finally gets to us and interrupts my niece as she places her order to run back to the kitchen.  

Inexcusable guest service, she made no attempt to interact with us.  I will not be coming back again.
My favor place to get pancakes and over hard eggs! Soo feeling! Makes me want to go to sleep right after lol BEST PANCAKES EVER!

Every time we are in Vegas this is our go to breakfast, lunch and even sometimes dinner. Parking is ample. Service is attentive. I think they renovated. I love that they make their dessert there. Never had one. But they do have a very pleasing display at the lobby. Foods is usually pretty good. Huge menu!
Another Delicious meal. Same thing eggs bacon & French toast with cawfee. Good waitress too

11am meant 45 minutes of wait time on the Flamingo and Decatur location so my group headed to another location by Decatur and Charleston. We arrived with a lady in the parking lot trying to sell me and my friend jewelry to buy laundry softener, super random and declined politely. Wait time was less than 15 minutes, getting our drink order was also quick and ordering just went smoothly. I admired the three plate specials displayed by the front along with the rotation cake fridge. I ordered a chilequile which meant I cleared my plate. My group cleared their plates as well and didnt forget to tip our server. While we were heading to pay our tab the wait line was pretty long but I was digging this old lady's style with wearing two eye glasses trying to keep the queue down.
So delicious. I got regular pancakes and they were so fluffy and tasty. One of the best pancakes. Bacon was nice and crispy which is a plus  definitely recommend this restaurant.
Great little spot for homemade food. Really good prices and a cozy atmosphere. Definitely one of my favorite local spots in Vegas.

Arrived for my lunch break at 2:00 was sat immediately, no waitress for 10mins we ask bus boy to find one, was advised one is on the way, waited additional 10mins then left, on the way out advised manager or whomever sat us that we're leaving because no waitress came, by he didn't seem too concerned

Can you say delish?  I was a little skeptical to try this place because of its location, but upon walking in, my mind was instantly changed.  It's more spacious than it looks from the outside and very clean and modern.

The food was amazing!  I ordered the chicken and waffles and it was a great take on what's usually a huge meal.  It was just the right amount of chicken and waffles and the breading on the chicken was delicious!  I would definitely return just for this!

They have a huge menu so there's a little something for everyone.

Service was decent and the server was friendly and helpful.
We had the Dixie breakfast meatloaf and it was fantastic! Plus the service was friendly and fast!

Go out of business . Always consistently Cold food, all the time, every visit, Only item hot was the Coffee & Soup.  very nice employees, big employee turnover, always completely empty....doesn't hire male waiters at all. only polite and inexperienced waitresses. Attempted again today cold eggs, cold burger, cold everything.   Over-worked waitresses leaves food to sit forever before bringing it to table this has happened on 5 different visits. I give up, I have tried to like this place but cant tolerate luke-warm and cold food. especially eggs.Way Way over-priced all you folks that gave this joint 5 stars are idiots with deep pockets and no tastebuds.    Once again though all the employees here are great, the food lacks taste and heat.
   I give up....

Last night I went to Blueberry Hill Rest on west flamingo and Decatur. It was the first time I went to that restaurant location. I want to say I had the best experience there along with my son. The servers name was Veronica. She was so attentive, and full of energy. She had recommendations for choices of food when I asked. Never pushy. If every restaurant had a server like her; business would be booming! Every restaurant needs a Veronica!! Thanks again! We will be back

Don't let the appearance fool you.  It looks like old Denny's from the early 80's. But, it's worth trying.

We have gone there for breakfast for the past few weekends.  I can't speak for all of the food, but the breakfast is great.  The omlets are as big as the plates they are served on, the pancakes are fantastic, and it never takes more than a few minutes to get the food to your table.  I'm not sure I have ever gone there and actually finished all of the breakfast, but I have tried many times.

Went here after we had a terrible experience at Las Vegas Little Theater. We aren't familiar with this area of town, so we cruised around. We saw that this had replaced Marie Calendar's, and my boyfriend read the reviews were good (turns out he read the Yelp reviews for a different location). So we decided to try here. I ordered two cheese enchiladas, my mom ordered a chimichanga, and my boyfriend ordered a bacon burger. My boyfriend loved it, but my mom and I thought ours were disgusting. The sauce on the enchilada was so strange... I don't even know how to describe it. The "shell" on the enchilada tasted and looked fake. My mom's chimichanga was full of peppers and onions. Refried beans were good. I was hungry and we bought it so I ate it. My mom ate a little of hers. Long story short, we all ran to the bathroom when we returned home. I still feel sick to my stomach. Only reason I'm giving 2 stars and not 1 is because the waiters were nice. Bottom line? Don't go here if you want a good meal and a happy stomach after.

Not my cup of tea..

Today a friend and I came here for breakfast.  We waited about 15 minutes to be sat and were greeted right away with water and coffee from the "busser" I believe.  A server then came over after a slight delay and we weren't quite ready so she said she would be back in a moment.. that was probably a 20 minutes later moment.  We even flagged down someone else who worked there and asked for our server.  We finally ordered which included a beverage.. 

We then received our food, still no drink, and there were breakfast potatoes instead of hashbrowns.  Rather than just apologizing and getting me what I ordered she showed me she had written down breakfast potatoes.. I work in F&B.. I don't really care what you write down.  I continued to wait for my drink until after the hashbrowns I ordered came out.  It was as if my drink was the dessert at the end.  

We then had to flag down our server again to pay as we had been there for nearly 1.5 hours at this point.  

I tried this place since I haven't been but I would recommend sticking to Babystacks or Egg Works for what you would expect at breakfast!

Good food, super friendly service, and an extensive menu. Breakfast, lunch, dinner at whatever time you want, but make sure to save room because you won't believe the selection of made-on-premises bakery items...yum!

Have been here twice now as it is close to my house. The service is always great and we never have wait to be seated. They have some great deals on food and the portions are good sized.
Let me say that if you are a true foodie, this place is not for you as it is not all homemade and is quick diner style food. 
The desserts here are all wonderful and make it worth the trip, along with the price and friendly servers.
It is nice to get off the crowded strip and be able to have a relaxing, easy meal at a reasonable price.
If you come here you will not leave hungry but leave room for dessert.

we go here about one a month ... turkey dinner $12.49  ... called for thanksgiving hours ... they are raising turkey price to $15.49 for the holiday  ... wait until i tell my senior friends!   .... what a rip off

Busy Sunday ....the wait was short, though.  We were served coffee and iced tea right away and our waitress, Bonney, stopped by to say she would be with us shortly.    Bonney was helpful with menu advice when asked.... thanks!   Ernie had the Meat Lovers Skillet and gives it a thumbs up.   I couldn't decide between a strawberry waffle or eggs -- Bonney said I could have both, LOL.   definitely have the HamSteak!  It was great--bone in and grilled nicely.  
We will be back when in town.  :)
A very good brunch experience.  We had to wait a bit for a table, but everything was smooth and quick once we were seated.  The food was delicious and satisfying.

This is our favorite breakfast spot in Vegas. We tried it on a whim last time we visited and have only ever been impressed. Aside from having an extensive menu, we feel very much at home and this particular location treats us incredibly well.

Ambiance is exactly what you'd expect from a "hometown" type diner. The staff is friendly and casual, the furniture and fixtures aren't the newest, nor are they the nicest, but they give off a warm atmosphere and it is very easy to feel comfortable here.

The service is always friendly and attentive. I couldn't ask for more from a five star restaurant, let alone a little family style diner. We always get smiles from our servers and our food is prepared quickly and correctly. Interacting with the staff here is always great.

The food is the highlight, undoubtedly. Blueberry Hill has an incredible menu and we've gotten a different item every single time we've been. It would take a long time to work your way through the entire offering. My personal recommendation is the four cheese French toast. Out of this world.

Blueberry Hill is a great place to get filled up for cheap and enjoy delicious food and gracious service. This is a "comfort food" place first and foremost. Nothing fancy, no glitz or glamour, just warmth and heartiness.

I had the biscuit and gravy 3-2-1 meal and it was amazing.  The portion of biscuit and gravy is what oh want them to be but never get;ginormous.  So amazingly delicious.  Definitely a unicorn of biscuits and gravy!!!!

An excellent place for breakfast!  It appears this is a 24 hour restaurant so probably their entire menu would be superb. If your hungry this is the place to be very large and generous portions!

Clean and wait staff friendly and helpful.

Another TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE!!! After 3 months i decided to gave this place another chance, BIG MISTAKE!!! I order steak and eggs, everything in my order and service was ok but the hash browns was HORRIBLE!!!!!!! Omg the potato was raw and green!! I ask my server and she replied , is the light, well dear im not blind, green is green to me!!! Potato was very old no ESCUSE !! never again.

So I finally went here for the first time my cousin claimed that it was an overpriced Denny's and to be honest with you I have to agree with her I'm only giving it one star because I did like the fact that when it says that sausage comes with it that it's a hot link and not just one of those little sausage links. I think I was better off just going to Denny's but I wanted to try something new so I don't think I will be going back there again.

Horrible service. The hostess looked up at us then went right back to doing whatever she was doing. She did not say hi or anything like "We'll be right with you" just continued working on whatever it was she was occupied with. We stood there until finally a younger girl sat us. Still, nothing was said but "follow her" --

The waitress Barbara walked up to the table and said with an attitude "Are you ready?" We started to order; the entire time she was very unpleasant not looking at us once, and throwing her hands up in the air when I asked what salad dressings were available. 
At that point I could no longer handle the negative service and as she started to repeat the order in a rude tone, I let her know we no longer wanted to eat here because she is rude. 
She then stated "I'm just repeating your order" again, throwing her hands up. 

Ended up at the location on the east side of town. Much better service. Barbara and her co-workers need to be removed from customer SERVICE

Save your money! My family and I went for lunch and the food stinks. I had a waffle and it was absolutely plain and small, for $9.00! My had band had an omelette and it was dry. I had found coupons online so when it was time to pay the very angry Hispanic manager came out shouting that's not her website and she doesn't take coupons. She was the worst "manager" I have ever encountered. I will definitely never go back.

We love coming here the food is so comforting and homey. It's great for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The staff is really nice and sweet. My favorite thing is the eggs Benedict and club sandwich. The desserts are just as good as well. It's really hard to choose what you want when you want everything.

I've always heard good things about this place but after my visit im not quite sure about that. My family always come to this location for breakfast or lunch, but for my first time coming along to with them for the late night dinner, i'de have to say that I'm thoroughly disappointed..

The customer service was not as great as i expected compared to other locations. Our waitress was not friendly until we started complaining about the food. And speaking of the food, it was not appetizing at all! The preparation just looked like rubbish. My father ordered the Bonanza Breakfast with ham, but when we got our food, the ham was burnt hard, so of course we got it replaced, and the second time it came out there was just a bunch of burnt char on it. Also for their french toast, it was not even cooked, it was soggy and still raw i couldn't even eat it. Very unprofessional and unacceptable to serve something like that. For a great word of mouth restaurant, i was absolutely disappointed. This might be my first and last visit.

I took my mom to this location since I have eaten here yet and our little group was hungry. Upon arrival I was in awe, this was great. Still reminds me a lot of the MC that was there before they took over, but still clean. Very Clean. We were seated in a booth that was comfy and was told our waiter would arrive shortly. Shortly must have ment 15 minutes because the busser with the coffee came by several times before we our water showed up.

Now our waiter, Josh, was a young kid. But boy did his face read disdain when he arrived at our table. We ordered right away. My mother ordered a piece of blueberry pie, I ordered the Bonanza, and my 5 year old ordered the kids mac'n'cheese with fries. 

Then we played the waiting game. Which actually didn't take long at all. My mom received her pie right away. Somewhat to our disappointment because we figured all our found would arrive together. Then came the other meals. I really wish we had taken pictures of the food. My "scrambled eggs" were a little on the runny side. and two pieces of bacon were somewhat burnt. (my daughter actually ate those) Her mac'n'cheese though had burnt noodles, or cheese or whatever it was. She took one bite and almost threw up on the table. Now she's a picky kid so I tried it.... She wasn't lying. It was thick and not creamy and tasted of the burnt whatever. So what does she do? Go to town on the fries.I really don't blame her for not eating it.

So here comes Josh, oh Josh, he asks how everything is and my daughter immediately replies "It's gross!" to which I then in turn tell him it was, when he reached for the plate I asked him to leave it because she was eating the fries. 
Fast Forward
Check time. JOSH DIDN'T REMOVE THE MAC'N'CHEESE FROM OUR BILL!
My kid didn't even touch it and you are going to charge me for it?!?! You even went to go take the plate! Honestly, I was so angry, we paid and left. We will not be returning, and I will not suggest. The only reason I'm giving it stars, is because the other two meals were delicious.

Great place. Price is just right, come hungry because they feed you and there is t anything I wouldn't recommend. Coffee and salsa is delicious, staff is very attentive, the restaurant and restrooms are clean. Overall a great place.

This is a really good place for breakfast the muffins are made fresh every morning the service is pretty good ,and the staff is really friendly. It is a pretty relaxed atmosphere so not to busy not to loud.
The food and service was fantastic.  Always go there when in Vegas.  Lots of parking and lots of good

We met up with some friends that were in Vegas at the same time.  They had spent a few years in Vegas for work and recommended this local gem!! Gem it was... packed to the gills and waited about 5-10 minutes for a table for 5.  Would wait even longer now that we have experienced their awesomeness! Local and casual... server never let our coffee get below half a cup, portions were huge and even through we were all tasting each other's tasty dishes, nobody could finish their own.  Breakfast tacos, pancakes, biscuits & gravy, chicken friend steak, all fantastic!!! Highly recommend, worth the wait and will definitely go back when we are in town!
This is my family's favorite spot to hit on the way out of Vegas. The food is so good, everything taste like a home cooked meal. Been coming here for 3 years now. Best place to eat near the strip.
Patty melt was amazing with great service. The restaurant was clean. Kind of hard to find out here.
Have to say great escape from the strip ..food was awesome..a little noisy....but all around a GREAT place .highly recommended.
Huge portions, fast, friendly service, decent prices.  The food is always excellent.  We bring family here regularly.

I've driven by this place countless times and never gave it much thought. The building was renovated a couple years back and the interior looks great -- reminiscent of bakeries/cafes out east with dark wood accents and floral cushions. The place is spacious with comfortable booths found throughout and TVs scattered around the dining room. It's not just a breakfast spot either, their extensive menu spans breakfast, lunch and dinner with a decidedly American bent, but plenty of options like Mexican and Italian fare. 

Their version of chicken and waffles ($9.79) consists of four small and breaded, coconut chicken tenders with just enough coconut flavor to taste without dominating the flavor. The waffle was pretty basic, but after pouring syrup on everything, it was delicious. Potato pancakes ($8.79) were pretty much giant hash browns. Three of them nicely fried and crispy. An order of kid's chocolate chip pancakes ($5.69) was massive. Much larger than any kid should eat and definitely large enough for 3 kids to share. The pancakes have chocolate in the batter and are topped with chocolate chips and whipped cream. Clearly this isn't a healthy choice, but fuck it... I have a sweet tooth and so does my kid.

Service was less than stellar with a grumpy older lady taking our orders and occasionally checking back on us. For those who don't want to sit at a table or booth, there's a bar area just inside the main dining room. 

3.5 Stars

This was my first time to vegas and I heard that this restaurant is the best for breakfast. We, the whole gang, decided to go and check it out. Food is so ono and our waitress was so nice and had a great sense of humor. A++++++ Def. going back there if I ever come back up to Vegas.
Get the French toast.  Best I've ever had.  Hash browns excellent too.  Didn't need any seasoning.  Highly recommend.

First time here was on St. Patty's Day! A busy day for this place but we had a great server - Bonney. She was extremely helpful in answering our questions and made sure our visit was perfect. So many wonderful items on the menu - I wish I could try them all! This is why I'll be coming back again and again. Potato pancakes were delicious! The country potatoes were so soft and tasty with Ranch dressing. Not too much seasoning and not bland. We didn't wait long either - for a holiday that is awesome. I like that the servers all help each other. They seemed to get along - at least in the public's view and that didn't go unnoticed.

I invite you to try this place - it's worth it in my opinion. So many different and unique dishes to try. Don't pass up the to die for desserts in the case to your left as you walk in.

Went in for a late night snack with my boyfriend to check this place out as it is pretty close to our home. The ambiance is pretty much what you would expect from any run of the mill dinner, nothing too exceptional. The service was quiet slow the night we went in, but the food was pretty tasty! I ordered the apple jam chicken waffles and my boyfriend got the club sandwich. Both were really tasty and a good late night snack. Blueberry hill wouldn't be my first choice for date night, but the food was decent enough to go again if it's late and options are limited.

Came in to Vegas early in the morning and found this restaurant. 
It appears pretty popular and if you are a pancake lover you will love this place. My daughters ordered the cinnamon pancakes and the Oreo pancakes. Both portions were so large and rich that neither girl could get more than halfway through it. 
My eggs and biscuits and gravy were very good and rich.

So I didn't heed the advice I got about the food lol it's different to me your basic breakfast I just don't like the way they serve their food such as the hashbrowns or the pancakes I prefer mine crispy and shredded theirs is soft and whole peels. Their coffee was good. Their pancakes are super fluffy I prefer mine not so fluffy. Our waitress Wendy though was awesome! She was able to deal with our large group just fine and was prompt with serving us. I'd give her 5 stars!

Surprised they're running a three-star average I'm rating it for what it is a franchise multiple location American type food featuring cuisine from Italian to Mexicans with above average homemade mass production food.  . I had the French toast and homemade hashbrowns yes homemade sweetie ordered the senior menu tina and fries. 

$28 with coffee and soda.   Server named Wendy extremely pleasant and efficient. 

Huge menu.

My Grilled Cheese was amazing and made to perfection. The cheese was gooey and the bread was toasted amazingly with the right amount of butter. You can definitely feel the home cooked country vibe.

Historical Facts:
Blueberry Hill Restaurant has been family owned and operated since 1966.
The food was excellent as I have the cinnamon swirl pancakes they were huge more than I could eat service was good also I would definitely come back again

This is a nice location decorated in a more modern style. We stopped by at around one in the morning on a Monday night and the staff was extremely friendly. Unfortunately, they were out of or unable to make mashed potatoes, pasta, or soup that evening so the meal options were much more limited than I would have liked. We stuck with eggs and toast and it was pretty good. The scrambled eggs were a bit rubbery but the toast, bacon, and hash browns were all really good. I'd definitely recommend this restaurant during normal business hours just maybe not so late on a weeknight.
Great family restaurant. Large portions. Breakfast was our choice that day and close to the Vegas strip. Wait for food took a little long but maybe because it was a Sunday morning.
This restaurant has great service and exceptional food. Huge portion size or you can get the mini portion.

Came in last night an as usual we always ordered a lot of food. If you're really hungry then come here cause all the plates where super loaded. My dad eggs and pancakes they were good. I had club sandwich excellent. My mom and aunt had beaded pork chops, they couldn't finish so we took and ate or for breakfast. Waitress was really helpful. Definitely recommended.
Very nice place to have brunch with family. Its been a long time since I tried this place in the late 90's.. so far everything looks amazing.

Wow can't believe I've lived in Vegas for 2 years and never heard of this place ! My fiancé and I were looking for a good brunch place and ended up stumbling upon this gem. It's a really nice diner . We started off with a Bloody Mary and a Mimosa . The Bloody Mary was the best we have had out here ! Great spice and portions ! The mimosa was made with fresh squeezed oj also well proportioned with the champagne . I had the chicken and waffles the chicken was juicy and the waffle were fluffy, everything had great seasoning . My fiancé had the omelette with the chunky potatoes . The potatoes were amazing they had that crisp bite into it . This has just become our new Sunday spot as there is so many things to try off the menu !

This is my go to late breakfast place (like 12-2am) the waitress (I forgot her name, short lady, short hair, waiting a table of 4 around 1am today) she was attentive and nice. 
I ordered the waitress special (Belgian waffle, 2 eggs and 3 slices of bacon). My boyfriend ordered (corn beef hash omelette with a side of French toast).
Best waffle I've had so far and the corn beef hash omelette wasn't too bad either.

There are so many things I like about this restaurant that I wanted to let them know the few problems I have so they get them fixed and I'll have a perfect restaurant to go to!  Blueberry Hill on Flamingo is in an old Marie Calendar's so the booths are big and comfortable.  Their menu is huge and has a dish to suit any craving.  They have a full bar which is a lot of fun too.  So, now the bad stuff. First and foremost, I DON'T WANT TO EAT TEFLON. Their skillets are served in the scratched up teflon egg pans that are no longer useful for quick-flipping eggs.  When teflon is scratched it chips and gradually comes off the pan.  Teflon is toxic.  It would quit easily get into your food.  The fact that they are using these for table service is UNBELIEVABLE.  Either strip all of the teflon off or throw them in the trash.  Those pans are not meant for table service.  They look cheap and the chipped teflon freaks me out.  The other problem I have is the over abundance of offensive noise.  The music is often too loud and the playlists are alternately depressing or irritating.  The volume on the television sets are often turned up as well so you are forced to listen to a mix of commercials on the TV and bad music from the PA.  I like that the staff is high-energy and has a lot of hustle but sometimes they make quite a racket slamming down silverware and shouting across the room.  The patrons are forced to raise their voices above all of this to hear each other with the overall effect being a constant assault on the senses. I hope this has been constructive because I really do want to keep going there.

Good food, large portions, reasonable prices. Powdered lemonade. Horribly slow table service at noon at the Flamingo location. 15 minutes and not even a menu or water. I was alone, but I walked out, shouting. Better service sitting at the bar when dining alone.

Came in with my family, a party of 7.  This is my first time here. 

The food was great, I had the Pancake Sandwich.  The kids had the Kids Chocolate Chip Pancakes... which had to be a mistake as there were 3 huge pancakes with chocolate chips for $2...
Folks and sister had the Chicken Parm...it had a nice presentation...but tasted flat.  It needed a lot of salt and parmesan cheese.  Brother in law had the Sausage Skillet.  The portions are generous.  The coffee is outstanding

The service is somewhat unconventional and there appears to be a lack of "must be adhered to standards" that you get at corporate restaurants... Service wasn't great...but it certainly did not suck.  With a little work by someone who knows the business, this easily could be a 4 or 5 star family diner.

So our trailer fried  a wheel bearing on the 15. Found a Napa and got some parts. While I'm fixing the trailer my awesome wife goes on Grubhub and ordered us breakfast from Blueberry Hill. It came quickly. The food was hot very tasty. Ya they delivered it to us on the side of the road. If their delivery food is this good I can't wait till we can go in

Ordered breakfast to be delivered via Grub Hub. Breakfast arrives & 4 full meals are missing. Never even got the chance to check the order because Grub Hub just dumped it at my office & took off. I called the restaurant Immediately. Female who took the call talk to the cook. I could hear the cooks say "yeah she messed up my order". Female on the phone said she could give me partial refund  but there was nothing she could do. If I wanted the food I would have to call GrubHub. This was after admitting that it was their mistake! Sad I won't be ordering from this restaurant again even if it's so close to my work and will customer service goes along way in building a relationship.

I LOVED the breakfast at Blueberry Hill. I ordered the Strawberry pancakes with a side of the Honey Coconut chicken. The pancakes were SOOO good -- they can definitely feed 2-3 people. The chicken was just ok. All in all, the meal was really good. I would definitely come back again.

I like the food here it's so good.  I love the service here as well. What I don't like is the hair in my food. Seriously. I went years ago and had a hair in my honey coconut chicken so I stopped going.  Recently a friend suggested going there so I thought I'd give it a try. Basically in two weeks I have been here 3 times. All three times I asked if the carrot cake has buttercream or cream cheese frosting, NO ONE KNOWS! I get varying answers so last night the hostess offered me a very small slice, paper thin so I could find out, because carrot cake can only have cream cheese frosting or I won't eat it. But in this paper thin slice what did I find? A BLACK HAIR. A fairly decent sized one. Luckily I saw it first thing, I pointed it out and said hopefully the rest of the cake isn't like that. At this point I simply don't care what kind of frosting it is because I will sadly NEVER go again.  The cook I saw behind the line wasn't wearing a hair net or a hat either.  Sorry but when I have only been to a place maybe six or seven times in my life, years apart and I get hair in food twice it makes you wonder how much hair are you consuming that you don't catch.  Never again!!! Sorry not sorry.

HORRIBLE service. There was hardly anyone in the restaurant. We waited an hour for our pancakes and waffles which never did come out. We finally got up and left. No apologies from ANYONE!  The waitress that waited on us (or shall I say never waited on us) forgot drinks, silverware and of course our food. When I went in search of her (after 45 minutes) I found her flirting with the cooks. She saw me and flat ignored me. When we were leaving, she saw us, got another server to act as management and then hid in the back. This was not the first time something like this has happened at this restaurant. Steer clear of this one. If you want Blueberry Hill, go to the one on Decatur. This one has not only bad service, but their food is not even mediocre compared to the one on Decatur.

This was my first time trying Blueberry Hill and I was excited because everyone talks about it so much. The food was decent and so were the prices but the service was terrible. Our drinks never got refilled, and by the time we were finished eating it took us 25 minutes to get the check.

horrible service.
      food i ordered (chicken noodle soup and fettuccine alfredo) was extremely bland, and greasy leaving much to be desired.

   bathroom was filthy

the entire experience was one i regret

What a surprise. A friend recommended the restaurant for dinner when we commented that we didn't want to deal with a casino for dinner. The food was excellent. We had the coconut chicken and waffles and the chicken Parmesan with spaghetti. The chicken had very light breading and was super flavorful. The chicken Parmesan was a healthy portion and delicious. Desserts here are s treat, the Oreo cheesecake was amazing. Ask for Gwen, she's delightful, tells a good story and provides great service.
Incredible breakfast dining experience. Great value. Get Nix as a server and get the best table service west of the Stardust in NYC!

What ever you do, DO NOT DO A TO GO ORDER FROM HERE using the website menu.  My order was so beyond messed up I ended up being late for work while the manager told me "that's not our logo" when I walked her through the link.  I wanted a skillet that doesn't exist anymore apparently?  I'm actually still waiting on a $14 wrong skillet as I type

I was in the restaurant industry for 20 years and this restaurant is as professional front and back as can be. The service and food are great:  Nothing fancy, but well executed consistently. 

We come here for breakfast, lunch or brunch everyday when we're in Vegas. We could eat for free at the hotel, but would rather be here instead. Everyone here treats us like family. The food quality is always above average and the place runs like a well-oiled machine. 

I told the Manager that he's doing a great job in hiring, training and employee retention. We always see the same staff for years because they truly seem to enjoy to work at this establishment. Their great energy and a positive attitude transfers to our overall experience every time!

I generally avoid reviewing chains, but my experience at this Blueberry Hill was bad enough that I felt it would be a disservice to my fellow Yelpers not to leave a review - especially considering there are nearby Blueberry Hill locations that have much better service.

Keep in mind this was at 11:30am on a weekday when the place was half empty:

- waited nearly 10 minutes to be seated despite only one party in front of us and tons of empty tables
- waited more than 10 minutes for someone to take our drink order (we were ready to order food, but he told us he couldn't take food orders and would get someone)
- waited another 10 minutes before we were able to flag down someone else to take our food order
- waited nearly 40 minutes more for our food to arrive

To top it off, our order was messed up in multiple ways (wrong type of toast, eggs cooked wrong, missing hash browns), and when we asked to complain to a manager, we were left waiting long enough that we just decided to pay the bill and leave. The only possible explanation I can have for my experience is that servers and staff here are not trained well and management just doesn't care. It's a real shame, as I generally prefer the food at Blueberry Hill to other chains.

Best pancakes I've ever tasted! My review is primarily based on the pancakes. I've tried two flavors, Oreo and chocolate chip, and both were really good. I've always ordered them to go. But the decor looks really nice. In the take out area or when you first walk in, you will see cakes. I've only tried the Oreo cake, which if you love Oreos or cookies and cream, will satisfy your sweet cravings. I have tried their breakfast there and I would have to say it's an average breakfast of omelettes and breakfast meats. But if you want to try one of the best (if not The Best) pancakes in Las Vegas come and pay this place a visit.

Great selection, great menu, great portions,great layout but so is the price. High end, not for the not so hungry or budget conscious. Great service,  parking a little tricky on the weekends. Better than the hotel buffets in Vegas.

There is NO WAY these could be the best blueberry pancakes anyone has ever had.  Worst blueberry pancakes I've ever had - hands down. 

The Blueberries are not fresh- they are frozen and tasteless, even the cup of blueberries they gave me on the side (which were thawed, cold and nasty) - the chefs should pop one in their mouth and see what they're serving people. People must be fooled by the blueberry compote they pile on of these pancakes. I opt out of the canned blueberry filling on top of blueberry pancakes so the "real" flavors can come through. This was very disappointing. Blueberry pancakes should never be made with old, unthawed blueberries.

The eggs and bacon were great though and so was the omelette my husband had, so I'm sure other breakfast items might be delish- will try something different if I come back again which I probably won't because there are sooo many other places to eat in Las Vegas. But I will recommend it to others as someplace to try for yourself. 

Prices are great for the amount of food you get and the customer service was lovely.

Ok so it was highly recommended to try this place ...I was not impressed. It seems like a Dennys to me. It pancake was ok. Our meals were ok. The hash skillet had too much potato and not enough meat. Maybe it was an off day for the cooks?  I don't think I will go back.

I must admit I was a little scared to try this place based on the reviews but we had the best experience. Our server was Felicia and she was awesome! I started with an Iris Coffee with the Turkey sausage, eggs and Pancakes. Let me tell you the pancakes are HUGE so you can really share them. My husband had the Honey Coconut Chicken and Waffles which was very good as well. Will be back!
Great food right outside the Vegas strip. I will definitely be going back next time I visit.
They have the best food, generous portions, and amazing staff. We've been coming here since they opened.

This is their newest location. I think it's also their best. Why? Well because there is a bar in this one. You can order drinks or sit at the bar (breakfast mimosas!) and watch tv during your meal. This location is not far from the strip. 
I grew up on the deliciousness that is Blueberry Hill. It honestly was a staple of my childhood here in Vegas. I've never had a bad meal or had anything I did not like. 
Breakfast is usually where I stay at on the menu. I've had lunch and I've had dinner. Both also good, the breakfast is what brings me back. Especially since it's offered 24/7.
Their pancakes are the BEST in town hands down. Made from scratch, not a box. Served with warm syrup and real whipped butter. It's carb heaven.
I'm also in love with their thick cut delicious sourdough toast. It pairs with everything from a BLT to dipping in my eggs over easy. 
The menu ranges from traditional breakfast options, Mexican breakfast and all kinds of great sugar stuff. You know waffles and stuffed French toast. Then there is lunch and dinner options. And if you hadn't noticed on your walk through the entrance, they do homemade desserts that make you wanna lick the window they're being shown off in. 
Seating options are booth, tables and chairs, 1//2 booth 1/2 table & chairs or the bar. So they a good for large parties too.

This place has mediocre food and has terrible customer service from the server/waitress. My father and I come here to eat breakfast at 9:30am then the hostess kindly sits us in a booth. We had to ask the backup server for water/coffee. Our waitress on the other hand completely ignored us and we asked her if she would take our order, since we were waiting for 20 minutes now, she bluntly said, "No, I'm busy with my tables you can wait." That's when my father and I immediately left to 'Egg & I'. I work a restaurant and there is no way that I'm going to respond to a customer in such a way that this waitress did let alone make them wait for 20 minutes just to place an order. If you're going to be rude and miserable then I recommend the waitress not to work in that type of atmosphere.

Bit of an issue with eggs ordered over hard and were a bit runny.  Nix provided exceptional service and recovered nicely from the cooks mistake.  I asked her to let the cook know what she did immediately.  Due to being an uber driver I didn't want to wait for a remake.  Let server know that I refer lots of tourists here which was met with an enthusiastic smile, thanks!

Excellent "off the strip" breakfast!  We were looking for something on our way out of town and came across this restaurant.  The food was fresh and delicious!  Service was excellent and the place is clean and bright.  We ordered: huevos rancheros, French toast with bacon, and a chorizo omelette.  The portions were perfect for 3 hungry adults.  Even our teen daughter finished her French toast and bacon (she doesn't normally eat a lot).  We left feeling satisfied and not sickly full.

I liked it.  Service was somewhat slow and not especially attentive.  I ate some strange concoction that involved a grilled biscuit, topped with meat loaf, strips of bacon, served with a side of mashed potatoes and veg.  Everything was covered in a thick layer of country gravy.  It was a little spicy.  It was really good, but it was so heavy I was not able to eat for 6 hours - and I didn't even finish half.  We also had a pretty good pasta dish.   Unfortunately, the waitress didn't offer and desert so we just left although the deserts looked good in the case - mostly cakes. 

I would try this place again, but I think I would split a meal.  The portion sizes are off the chart - which is a good thing.   The side dishes are a little wanting.  The steamed veg not so good.  Mashed potatoes not bad.  The county gravy needed more meat, but was passable.  The bacon was top notch.

The decor is basically a Marie Calendar's location that closed.  Traffic in and out of the parking lot is a nightmare.  The place is huge inside, but strangely laid out in odd seating sections.

I have to say I was very pleased with there food. Me and my buddy ordered a burger and wow the meat is delicious and huge ! I would come back if I'm ever in town again. I give it a 2 thumbs up. Have a variety or choices of food to choose from.
Great place to eat large menu reasonable prices I've been going to this restaurant for many years tried all the different locations in town and never been dissatisfied.

Love this place.  Service is excellent.  Food is better than IHOP or Denny's and similar breakfast places.  And its 24/7!

The muffins are awesome.  You can also order them grilled which added an extra dimension to their already delicious muffins.  The topping on the muffin tops are so good.

Apple pancakes also very good and you get A LOT of them!  Light and fluffy with just the right amount of sweet.  The only weird thing I found was that they serve the cooked and raw apples with the rinds on.  It didn't really add any value to the apple taste.

The cheese burger was very good too.  They boast never frozen, 100% angus beef.  Whatever it was, it was juicy and flavorful and cooked perfectly.  I do wish they seasoned it more, however, I guess they need to cater to a broad spectrum of tastes.

When we left, I noticed their display for ribs.  THEY SERVE IT ON A BAKING SHEET!!! Whoa!  Going to have to try it!  Lol and split it among 2-3 people!

Pretty good food. Nice waiter. Was expecting a little better place. But no real complaints. 

Kentucky fried steak was ok. Monte cristo sandwich was a large portion and good. 

I have no reason to put this place on my return list. So this time it's a check mark. Tried it and let's move on.

This is usually one of my foot breakfast spots. I always get the French toast. If they are on it  I ask for well done and it has a nice lil crunch. Otherwise when they are busy they may mess  that up. Often times there's a line and to be completely honest the young lady at the bar is a better server anyway. She's in touch with her customers and engaged. This place is an upgraded version to a classic spot. Tv's all over the place. No neighborhood feel

We ordered breakfast from GrubHub, I asked for pancakes with strawberries and whipped cream. They came with a few old, soggy strawberries thrown on the top, no strawberry sauce or whipped cream. The pancakes were very old and crusty. I removed the first 2 pancakes because the strawberries were smashed all over them hoping to eat the last one on the bottom, but there was a bite taken out of the side! I am so disgusted I can't believe they would send this out for delivery to a paying customer and not even give a refund or send better food!

We had a such fantastic time at this place. We came to Vegas to celebrate a friend's birthday and came here for breakfast three days in a row. Asked for the same server (Shannon, I believe)because of her wonderful friendly service. When we come to town for a visit we will definitely stop by here again!

So i came to breakfast with my kids and husband only to get ignored by our waiter? Cecar hasnt even hace us refills...after 20 min of siting here he took our drink order...the bus boy was way more helpful..
I worked for bbh for over 10 yrs and this is sad.....

Looked busy by got seated quickly . coffe and drinks fast too. The food took 30 min to come out. But the waitress was nice , upbeat, and on top of refilling our drinks . stick to the waffles , pancakes, and creaps . potatoes and bennidic was bland . 
Coconut chicken waffle was great.
I love coming here when , it's satisfies any craving I have at any given time of the day ! Literally they have everything ! Should try it out !

Norma royalty screwed up!!!!

I love BlueBerry Hill. I've brought my mom, family and Fiance here a couple times. And we have family visiting next month and plan to bring them here. ...BUT...NOW we might not come. 

June 14, 2017 approximately 8:30pm. We came for a late dinner. I called ahead of time to see if there was a wait. I was told no. When we got there we had the wait like 5 minutes for them to clear off tables. ...restaurant wasn't even a 1/4 full. And many tables were already set up. Then the Hostess seats us all by ours ourselves in another section of the restaurant.  Tell us our waitress will be right with us....nope....after like 10-12 minutes we had to send my son to ask for our waitress. ..then she came over.. didn't greet or even apologize for I ur wait.. just asked if we know what we want.

We order a Monte Cristo Sandwich and I Double Chesse burger. She asked if I wanted the one with Chili. I said Definitely not. Just the cheese burger. She said okay left.   

After a few she brought over our food. My son order was right expect for no extra sauce on the side as requested.  And she handed me a Chili Chesse Burger.  I said oh no, I didn't order that.  I said I can't have Chili, I have intense heartburn. That would be a bad thing for me to have. She said oh, I thought you order it. She didn't apologize nor say she would handle it, instead she said can we just scrape off the Chili? She said I have a group of 18 over there.

 What?!?!?!!!!

I was offended that she ask to scrape off the chili off my burger and give me the same sandwich back. She didn't offer to make me a new one. I told her it's already late and if she not able to just get me a new one soon. Go ahead, I couldn't have the Chili.  She ended up taking it back to the kitchen then brought it back to me. 

As habit I took the top patty off to ear and noticed there was still chili on the burger. They just swapped the bottom for the top patty. I wasn't happy at all but it was coming on the 9:30 now she came back and ask if we were okay. We pointed out the problem and I said I don't feel like I should have to pay for a this kind this. She said no, I'm going to waive the charge for it. She said she just wants to make it right. I said it will be fine. I WAS through the roof, upset at this point. 

I started eating one of the patties, then a few minutes later she brings me a new burger. I said okay, I didn't ask her to do that. I Ended up eat like half and boxed the rest up due to me losing my appetite.  

After she brought me the second hamburger,  we were completely ignored by all staff members.  Until the Hostess came over to bring me the ticket.  So obviously wasn't ask if everything was okay, do we want dessert,  is there anything else like drink refills .. 

When we went up to pay the tickets was showing full price. I told to the hostess that our server said she would to comp the burger due to a mix up. She asked the waitress she said no, she ended up getting the right one. I said excuse me, you said you would take care of her. She mumbled something and the Hostess changed my total. 

I was completely disturbed how the situation was taken care of and the to do it.

I am going to reach out to management in the morning. 

Thanks for reading, 

Victoria Martinez 
Executive Housekeeper

When I first came to Las Vegas seven years ago I ate at the BH on Decatur at Charleston. It was disastrous. Another year or two went by and I figured that it was a fluke. No, no, I had an almost identical experience and said, "Never again!" 

Now, years later, I was talked into going to a different BH on West Flamingo. 

This is what happened: The table staff started to pour coffee into a cup that was clearly dirty. The staff was looking directly into the cup and beginning to pour when I pointed out how dirty the cup was. 

Back with a new cup, he filled it and left. I looked around the table for some Half and Half and there wasn't any. Lots of chemical choices but I don't like the aftertaste. I had to wait a considerable time to get H&H and by then my coffee was cold. 

The restroom: Only one toilet (!) and it was filthy. I haven't felt the need to use a tissue toilet seat cover for probably 30 years but I had to at BH.

Then the hand dryer just made a little rattling noise and put out no air.

Bye, this time for good. There is no excuse for this level of institutional ineptitude and mismanagement.
Cute little place to eat dinner. Lots of variety in choices. The homemade roll is the best part!
Food and service was amazing!! Highly recommend. Best french toast and homemade hash browns ever. If you are in the area, you should definitely have breakfast here.

Very unique place to eat. Came here with my family and I will say the food was delicious. Employees had great customer service, I even ask what would they recommend and they were kind of enough to over the menu with my family. Very fantastic experience for my first visit thank you I definitely will be back.

The wait for our food was ridiculously long (at least it was good). The table next to us also had a long wait.  We were in the restaurant for almost an hour & a half.  Then when I told the manager after we ate, all he could say was "oh."  He even asked our waitress & she agreed that we had to wait a long time.  Guess I'll stick to the one on Decatur & Charleston!

After my last visit to Blueberry Hill,  customer service replied to me with a kind gesture.  Thay apologized about the employee and took care of the situation also they sent us a gift card for our next visit. Thank you again Blueberry Hill,  we appreciate your company and oncw again you are one of our favorite eatery!

This was pretty good. The food was fantastic! The service however was average. My husband and I both work in the industry and we were not impressed. However I think we would go back just for the food.

My husband had a skillet that was to die for and I went with the 3 cheese and berry French toast. Both delicious. We'll return next time we are in town.

This place was such a disappointment from the other location at Charleston and Decatur.  The service was extremely slow and not thoroughly cooked.  I could see if it was busy and the food was rushed we were one of three customs in the restaurant.  I ordered the  the 3 X 3 special.  The pancakes were so thick they still had runny batter. The bacon had good flavor but was hard and over cooked,  it tasted like it was saturated in grease. I Also ordered I side of chunky potatoes which were hard and undercooked with no flavor at all.  The weird corky waitress gave me hard time for ordering extra food saying it world be to much for me. I never had a waitress try talking me or of ordering something extra.

We had issues with our food, but the cashier Chantel suggested we speak to her manager.  We agreed.  Chantel called Joyce and Joyce asked politely how she can assist.  Just wanted to at least post that they were nice enough to take care of it out of the dissatisfaction weve received.

This restaurant is hands down the Best in Las Vegas and only 5min from the strip.  They not only have excellent customer service but their food is to die for!  They have huge portions on everything from their homemade breakfast to dinner..also you need not try their cakes..like heaven!  My favorite place to eat in Vegas!! Go eat here if your hungry you're belly will be happy you did!

Food was pretty good. Decent price. Tried their french toasts and country fried steam and it was yummy!!! Our server took a while to come to us but water and menus were brought to us by staff right after we were seated. I just wished their portions were bigger for the french toast. We paid as we exit but was unsure on where to pay at first no one came back to check on us and the bill was just left in the table by the server

My friends & I decided to check out this location because it is new.

The hostess sat us down & we skimmed our menu.

I ordered the Oreo pancakes & my two friends ordered a simple breakfast platter & fried chicken.

We waited almost an hour for our food. The old guy who got seated after us (he looked like a regular) got his food almost immediately along with a few more tables surrounding us.

The bar was empty so they were not that busy.

When we tried to ask for our waitress, the man we tried to flag down just ignored us thinking "you are not my table...."

All our food came out one at a time in about 5 minute increments.

My pancakes were still soggy/wet/uncooked in the middle.

The waitress asked us if there was anything else we needed to which I replied, "sugar-free syrup." I had to repeat myself because she did not listen the first time.

Overall, the long wait, the food being undercooked, the attitudes that the waitress & another worker gave us made the experience very upsetting.

I, along with my friends, will never go back to this place again!!!
