A Las Vegas classic diner joint, the newest location, I was pumped to try an old favorite I hadn't visited in a long time.   We were seated quickly. It took us a while to peruse the HUMONGOUS menu. I settled on a plate for my kids to share and they also got pancakes.   I confirmed with the waitress that it would be a big serving. Our two meals came out in three stages, pancakes, 7 minutes, my meal,  10 minutes, their meal.   Their meal was not a big serving, but the pancakes were. Their scrambled eggs were sloppy and kinda wet. The presentation blech, but kids ate it since they had to to obtain pancake heaven.  My potato pancake Benedict was awesome, but stingy on the hollandaise, one poached egg had about 1 tablespoon of sauce.   It was delicious, though. Top notch, just, I'll get more sauce next time.  Bill was just over $30....I found that high for two meals, one coffee, and two kids sized milks.

This was my first time eating fried chicken waffles and it was pretty good. The only thing I'd really say about the chicken was that it was slightly more crispy than usual. However, the portion is good and the service is nice as well.

Used to love this place but they're ridiculous now! A shake is $5+$3 extra for blueberry even tho blueberries are cheap as 70 cents a pint right now! Then if you see the pic of the grilled cheese that isn't grilled (what a joke) for $10 - also no kids menu after 10pm?! Overpriced & not very good quality / This place went WAY down - nvr again
The chicken and waffles were amazing! Definitely another visit in my future. The wait staff was great as well. Plenty of options to choose from and they're open 24/7!

Well first and foremost the cinnamon pancakes have to be the best pancakes in town!! Syrup isn't needed that's how delicious these were

First my experience here was pretty good we were seated by a host in less than 5 mins (lunchtime) very friendly staff

Server arrived fairly quick and was friendly greeted with smiles...served us beverages we ordered apple juice (which was cold some places neglect serving cold apple juice for whatever reason) but the water tasted like tap some people like myself are fairly anal about that but I couldn't bare drinking it 

Next server took our order which was a basic four , four , four breakfast with eggs , bacons and pancakes and also I ordered the speciality cinnamon pancakes 

After that the speed in which we received our food was legendary, however as most know that's not always a good thing could mean cold food or just bad quality HOWEVER that was not the case the pancakes were extremely delicious, bacon was average as well as eggs but i stand firm these our the best pancakes in town by far...

One thing I did not like at all was we were served our checked with our food basically.. it made me feel like I was rushed this was a family trip so we weren't at the bar we were at the table.. I suggest future reference that they present the check when they are 100% for certain the customer is satisfied. It can give off a bad vibe if you present the check with the dinner.

Pros
--------
Pancakes , servers attitudes, preparation time, 


Cons 
-----------
Water , delivered check with the food,

Excellent!! On our way out of Vegas, we stopped here because of the great Yelp reviews...didn't disappoint. My boyfriend & I got the Eggs Benedict & chicken fried steak plate. We shared & had leftovers. We will definitely come back here when come back to Vegas!

It's been a year since we celebrated our nieces birthday breakfast here.  We had a great time then and a delicious time this morning!
The waffles melt in your mouth because they serve them hot!!
Yum! The food was great!  Like a better version of dennys or Ihop, just be prepared for a wait!  Crepes were great,  would love to go back!

This is one of our fave spots for breakfast with my ohana. Love the atmosphere and menu selection.

Today was a particularly slower day in the morning which was nice, no wait and quick ordering. The menu is pretty vast, breakfast, lunch, dinner, desserts.... whew! About 8 or 9 pages to it. All kinds of breakfast selections pancakes, waffles, omelettes the list goes on.

As you walk in you are greeted with a waiting area in the lobby and a specials board (mimosas & bloody marys were on that board today) as well as a grand display of cakes and pies See my photos to see what was in todays case! Mmmmm. Carrot cake!!!!

The dining room has lots of seatings for small or large groups as well as an old school diner style seating at the counter. As we were sat the dining room wasnt too crowded which is a good sign, fast food! Instead of looking at the menu we opted for the specials today. Real simple! 2 Mini waffles w/eggs and sausage ($8.99) for my little and a spinach and cheese omelette add bacon (+$1.69) (total $9.99)
Everything came out quick along with my coffee and OJand my little was satisfied with her chocolate milk ($3.09 and no refills) dang!!! Thats okay she was pleased especially with that whipped cream for her waffles 

The service is always good when we come no complaints. Today was slower then normal so expect a waittime on the weekends. 

Love Blueberry Hill!!!!!
Good ambience, nice to get off the strip for a breakfast. Clean and decent service. Food I had (Irish eggs Benedict )was hot and good.

Amazing food, got the potato pancake eggs Benedict and the egg was cooked to perfection, which most everywhere I go they over cook it even just a little. The service is fantastic our waitress made sure to offer great substitutes for things they didn't have ready yet and persisted on giving us what was missing when it was ready. Great little diner
Our family goes every time we go to Vegas. Food is great! Not expensive and portions and a great size. I am able to share a club sandwich and be full!

Came here due to it was literally in front of us & we had no idea what we wanted & were hungry. 
Apon walking in they have a huge array of cakes of all flavors to entice your sweet tooth. 
Place was quiet & waitress was very nice..
I was having a sugar attack & ordered a slice of coconut cake... My friend ordered meat loaf..the menu read Home cooking. It was a big mistake to assume "home style cooking"meant they made a good meat loaf...or dessert.
The plate of food looked like cafeteria food. Nothing on it was the least bit appetizing. Granted meat loaf is rather ugly..food looked plastic & lifeless. 
My slice of cake - dryyyy, The frosting was ok.. I was truly disappointed because their display case was really well done..We barely ate the food. 
Place has a big menu. 
Open 24 hours which may be the most useful thing about it, if you are absolutely starving ,on one & in need of something to put in your stomach.
Mehhh..

Great selection of American, Mexican style breakfasts and other kinds too. My favorite is simple grilled cheese sandwich on sour dough if I have a carb craving. I like the cozy environment of a diner here plus they have a nice mini bar you can get cocktails and food to eat as well. They offer plenty of cakes and bakery options and also one unique thing is they make there own fudge which is great if you have a sweet tooth! Prices are moderate. Staff is very friendly even on late night shifts. Big portions.

I've eaten here before and the food was good but these last three time were all epic fails! I don't know if they got a new chef or vendor or both. My bacon was sooo salty I couldn't eat it. The meatloaf and potatoes were Luke warm. The corn was good. The chili was a disaster! Chili made with pork n beans???? Disgusting!! It wasn't hot to the point the cheese did not even melt. Traded it in for chicken noodle soup. It was HOT but the veggies and noodles were soggy, not chewable. The gravy was a strange consistency probably homemade because it was lumpy. Stick to fried foods!

Bring your appetite because they serve huge portions. So you get what you pay for.

The place is clean and spacious. 

Service is always great! And the menu is extensive. 

I can't speak for any other items on the menu, aside for the breakfast options; which are pretty basic in my opinion.... so you can't really mess up lol. 

Today I ordered the Tennessee fried steak and eggs, with a side of chunky potatoes extra crispy (of course)!!! Steak was 6.5/10 for me, it wasn't very fried; but I didn't really mind. The parts that were fried ended up being super soggy. So I stay stick to the 10oz sirloin. 

The omelettes are huge too! And always come out 8-9/10. Can't go wrong.

I frequent this place when I'm in Vegas because my boyfriend's family loves this place. No complaints here.

So many choices on the menu. Fresh baked goods, pies everything was amazing. Ordered a for breakfast very delicious. It services impeccable our way just had been with the company for decades and had nothing but positive things to say. Care for children or just having breakfast or lunch again so many options must go

Just out and about and needed a nearby breakfast and this was it. The menu they have is massive. Like it's really too big its way past the point of diversity and just takes way too much time to go through just to see all your options (I like small and simple). Anyway we ordered the pancakes all around (buttermilk, fresh apple, and smiley face) while we waited I took the kids to the bathroom to wash their hands and the men's bathroom smelled terrible and was pretty unclean I cringed thinking my toes might touch the floor in my flip flops. Came back and food was there quickly but the portions were MASSIVE which is usually nice but I wouldve rather paid less and gotten half since pancakes don't really reheat the best. Gf sent back her pancakes because they were too tough and the server was very nice and insistent that we did so and took it off our bill hastily which was really nice. My fresh apple pancakes were pretty good but I'm a big guy and I could only finish half of them. 
Overall this place seems to be really popular but it's just not my piece of cake. Really think they should have smaller portions and not just serve and charge for your breakfast and reheated lunch. Probably won't come back since I feel iHop is better. 
3 stars because of the bathrooms and the all the food besides mine wasn't really that good.

Was in Vegas last week and craving for breakfast after a few hours of gambling downtown. Found this place on Yelp and was very happy.  I had the  Tennessee Fried Steak and Two Eggs (6-oz. Certified Angus Beef sirloin steak lightly breaded with our homemade "Tennessee" breading, topped with your choice of raw or grilled onions and lemon. Served with three buttermilk pancakes or hashbrowns with toast and jelly. - $13.49).  It was divine and a side of fluffy pancake. Worth the price and calories. This is a gem of a place!
I think I would best describe this as a better Denny's.  The food is good and so was the service.  The pancakes were huge, anything more than the 3 is overkill.  The hash browns were not the best

Went here today for breakfast and my mom specifically asked for the old fashioned meatloaf. When the server came back, they gave her Dixie meatloaf. She asked why it was like that and the server said, "it's the same thing from the dinner meatloaf, just take off the gravy and bacon on top and the biscuits at the bottom." The server lied to us because when we got our bill, it clearly said there that the server wrote down Dixie meatloaf. Never coming back here again.

Service was fantastic but the food was mediocre. The place is immaculate.  Great atmosphere and super clean. The server was great. Super sweet and took great care of us. But the food...

The food wasn't very good. I got the roasted turkey dinner because who doesn't love a thanksgiving turkey dinner?! Well, I was disappointed unfortunately. The turkey was dry, the stuffing was bland, the the mashed potatoes were cold and the corn was very salty. I really wanted it to be all that I wanted and more but that wasn't the case. My fiancé got the country fried steak which was okay but nothing spectacular. Guess we should've stuck with ordering breakfast food. Apparently their French toast is delicious. 

I probably wouldn't go back. I give it 3 stars because the place is very nice and service was great.

Omg! Blueberry "Hill?!" A more accurate name would be Home of the Glorious, Mythological, Sacred Food-Mountains. With the portion sizes, you're pretty much getting 2 (or even 3) meals for the price of one! Great value! And after my boyfriend and I finished almost everything, the waitress didn't even laugh at us or tell us about health problems that could occur from eating so much. 

There was a great selection - it's not just breakfast.  The dinner meals are fantastic, also. And don't even get me started on the desserts... Great atmosphere, very clean setting, good customer service... An awesome experience overall. I'll be telling all my friends about this place :)

The Black Bear had a 45 minute wait. So good old Yelp took me here!  The place is tastefully decorated. Very clean  

The breakfast was fantastic. I base all breakfast joints on their Chicken Fried Steak and theirs was great!! New spot when in Vegas
***Check your credit card statement.  The server adds additional to his tip.  Checked my credit card statement and it charged more then what I signed for.  Will be calling the manager.

Don't waste your time or money, a better meal can be found at burger king next door. My sister sent back the turkey dinner because it smelled disgusting and unhealthy. The chicken salad was completely flavorless but maybe I could have tasted it if they put more than one tablespoon of chicken salad on the bread. Although the little bit of it that I had tasted like clean water. The chili, total garbage...it advertised meat and beans in the coli but I have yet to find meat.
Needless to say, I recommend eating someplace else

I was assigned to bring pastries to work one day. I remembered my work had catering brought in from here for a holiday and decided to go in and check out the goodies. I was able to pick up a nice assortment of treats to please my coworkers. The cashier was friendly and they were quick to take my order and send me on my way! I liked the small town feel of the place as well. Definitely reminded me of grandmas cooking. Great place to try out if you haven't.
This is a great place for breakfast! Big portions, great service, and fantastic Bloody Mary's.

Went here for breakfast and I wasn't disappointed. Our waitress wasn't the best but that was the only minor thing that wasn't good. I ordered the Tennessee steak and eggs with a side order of pancakes. I ordered my steak medium and it came out well done (blah). Even though it wasn't cooked to my liking it wasn't tough and it was still flavorful. The pancakes (OMG!) some of the best if not THE BEST pancakes I've ever had!! They were light and fluffy and HUGE!! The portion sizes are huge and although i was starving i needed a to go box. My friend had the sausage , egg and apple pancakes. There were no complaints from his side of the table. Next time i come to Vegas, I'll be back!

I drive past this restaurant on my way to work every single day and finally decided to try it out! 

I arrive at around 10:30 and surprisingly beat the morning brunch crowd, which was a big plus! Our server, Jessica had some really appetizing recommendations. One of which, I had to indulge in. The Very Berry French toast was the BEST French toast I've ever tasted in my life. 

The eggs Benedict came out looking super tasteful! The diced potatoes were so delicious, I wish I ordered some to-go! 

The kids menu is so full of many choices, I was surprised my daughter took a VERY long time to decide. Her pancakes came out looking so appealing to her, she chowed it down so fast. 

I absolutely love the fact that this is a FAMILY restaurant, only because I have 2 young children inherited my raging hangry attitude. The crayons was a perfect touch to distract them while our food came out. It was also cool how they tag-teamed to deliver our food to the table, rather than multiple trips. 

Jessica recommended so many items, I'll be back to knock them off the list! She is definitely one of the cooler servers I've ever had in a dining experience, which will definitely bring me back again!

Can't wait to try more!

First visit to this location, having only been to the E Flamingo location, and this one was nicer inside.  I had the Dealers choice with the 8oz ham steak and it was delicious. I was leery cause sometimes ham can be dry when ordered out, but this was cooked perfectly.  3 eggs sunny side up and crispy hash browns completed the meal. Coffee was just meh, but drinkable.  Wife had cinnamon swirl pancakes and it was huge. Four large pancakes covered with a sweet icing like the cinnamon buns you get in the can. Wife ate 2 and took 2 home. Service was excellent, always filling the coffee and water glasses. Present without hovering. Will definitely go back

Just finished breakfast here and got the chef's special of one French toast piece (two wedges which threw me off but that was my fault for not reading lol) eggs and sausage and my fiancé got a special that came with two humongous pancakes, two meats and eggs. Everything was so delish. I love the pricing and it was within walking distance from out place at the Palms Suites.

Great place. Enjoyed the Meat Lovers Skillet. The Cinnamon pancakes are awesome. 
If you come here, please ask to be seated in Nix section. She is awesome. She is very knowledgeable, fun, spirited, and very professional. 
Thank you, Nix for a great breakfast.

This place is a good place to eat off the Strip.  Very good prices.  The Menu has everything you can think of.  I was disappointed in the Cornbeef hash because it was from a can, but it was still good. The breakfast potatoes were great. You have to come hungry.  The portion sizes are ridiculous.  To make it even better this place has great service.  I WILL BE BACK.

Blueberry hill is a super cozy restaurant located on Flamingo down the street from the palms. I've been here a couple times, my boy friend loves this place. It's great for brunch, reminds me of a Marie Calendars with the desert display in the front. I always get the chicken and waffles which are delicious. The Oreo cheesecake was really good too. Last time I was there I ordered a mimosa which was more juice than champagne, I was a little upset about that. Other then that I've never had any complaints, the service is always fast and they are friendly. I'm going to to try the pancakes next time which I heard were bomb!

My husband and I really enjoyed the Tennessee Steak and Eggs breakfast. The steak had light breading.... great taste... along with the cooked onions on top... YUMMY! The service was great. The restaurant is very clean and the staff was very courteous. We will be coming back to enjoy another great breakfast!

Wow. This food was great. We ordered it to be delivered to use on the side of the road through grub hub and when the food was delivered it was hot and delicious. The driver that delivered the food was friendly and she had a great personality. Next time we are coming through Vegas we are coming to the restaurant. A+++++++++

The secret restaurant for locals and only a short distance from the strip. Best for 24 hour breakfast and lunch. The baked on premises cakes and pies are humongous and always fresh. Their buttermilk pancakes are famous. How ever I prefer their french toast ...the best this side of the moon.Eggs Benedict are offered 4 different ways...one of my other favorites here.  I've been here a thousand thousand times. Any time I'm in the area I'll be headed there.
Something about the food here didn't taste right to me. It did come recommended (that's why we went there) but everything seemed poorly done to me. I hope, for their sake, it was just an off-night.
This was real good "down home" breakfast!  Great service and real friendly.  Will come again when in Vegas!!

The food was delicious the service was great. The only thing wrong was the sticky stuff left on the water glasses and the silverware had stuff still on them but overall a good experience for the first time.

Really good place to get breakfast food if you're not looking for a dennys or IHOP. Similar food but a lot more! I love the corned beef hash omelette. You get to choose a side of potatoes or pancakes and so I chose the pancakes. I didn't know a side was 3 full sized pancakes! The omelette was huge too (4 eggs I believe). Great place to get your breakfast fix

eh...just ok. Went for breakfast. Place maybe had 3 customers and service was slow. Our waitress was a little quirky. Food was just ok. bacon way overcooked, pancakes are good, but really thick. Don't get the chunky potatoes, they are undercooked and flavorless.. honestly we have better breakfast at farmer boys and for half the price

I have been to the location up on Decatur and this one. This is a much nicer restaurant on the inside (mainly because it is newer), and the food is just as pleasant. I enjoy their pancakes and breakfast very much. I also like some of their lunch options. On my last visit, I enjoyed the patty melt. The only down side is the onions were not a cooked as I like and some were very crunchy. I am used to the onions on the patty melt being cooked until soft. Other than that it was good. This by far is not a phenomenal place to eat, but it does the trick especially at breakfast. I would recommend it if you want breakfast and diner style food, but if you are looking for the best of the best this is not your place. We will be back from time to time.
I take my mom here ecery time we get our hair done next door. Extremely good service and even better food.

Arrived at 8:30pm, was seated and right off the bat our waitress, Halle, immediately began complaining about her day. After ordering, she proceeds to complain about the food they serve saying it's "gross" as well as making very unacceptable commentary on the customers at other tables. One comment she made was "they're so f***ing needy." Soon after, she drops off our food to the table and immediately asks "could you guys check out early so I can leave?" Unbelievable. Never have I ever been rushed to eat and pay at a restaurant because the waitress didn't want to stay. I ordered nachos, which were meant to come with various toppings and it was only cheese, and the chips were burnt black. After letting her know she became irritated and scratched it off the check and says "there, took it off. Eat it if you want I guess." didn't even OFFER to make a new plate. This was my only entree. She talked over me and I had to wait to flag her down to have a new one made, she was busy chatting. She handed our table off to another waitress (who was very kind) and she was out the door. I guess the managers are gone after 6pm according to young lady up front, but I have a card and will be contacting manager tomorrow. This was the most unprofessional, appalling behavior I have ever encountered from a waitress. Very disappointing considering I've been a loyal and repeated customer for years. It's been a couple hours now and my roommates, as well as myself, are still very bothered by our experience tonight.

We love the food here. But our server today Tammy was just not on her game. First she spilled my coffee. I had to ask 3 times for creamer. She was very snarky to us while we were ordering our food. Then brought out the wrong order. 
Needlessly to say breakfast was not enjoyable today. 
Tammy please smile & write down what we order.
I ate here for a late night snack and for a brunch one morning. Both were great experiences with good food and good service.  The pancakes are out of this world!

This place is amazing.
The food has large portions and you can find anything you want from pancakes to steak and Eggs + everything in between.
Service is quick and friendly.

Both times we visited this place there was a little wait of about 20 minutes but totally worth the wait.

Go hungry for good quality family food!

This place is WAY better than Denny's and ihop. Better prices with better food. This place provides all day breakfast, great & friendly staff & did I mention great food? The portions are bigger as well so you never leave hungry. This place is great for family gatherings, dinner dates or breakfast dates.

Service at this location is less than average except one server Tammy, she was friendly and did her job well.  Won't go back unless she is my server... Live in the area but will go to another restaurant if Tammy is not working........

One of the challenges when you come with your family is finding an affordable place for breakfast. Don't get me wrong, I enjoy all the Strip Buffet's and fine dinning but sometimes your just not in the mood for all the "extra" aka waiting, driving, etc.. so having a place like Blueberry Hill off the strip and near our hotel (walking distance) was ideal. 

Its a traditional breakfast restaurant with a lot of options (can be good or can be bad) but you know it will carry the staples from Pancakes, French Toast, Waffles, Omelettes, sandwiches, soups,.... you get the point. Excellent food and breakfast was consistent with what we expected. Our selections of food varied from the Waffle w/coconut Chicken, Chocolate chip pancakes (lots of chocolate chips), spaghetti, and Tender Pork Loins with a few sides. Again, we were all over the place but everyone was happy. 

When ordering, ask questions and don't expect it to be the same thing you got back in you home town at the local breakfast spot. For example, it comes with sausage... is it a link or a patty, is it port or beef... is it fried or panko covered, what's in the salad, can i get it on the side... you get the point. 

Over server was cool and kept the refills of water and soda's coming. They have a great selection of desserts to choose from when your getting ready to leave (mainly cakes). Given our proximity to our hotel off of Flamingo, we would definitely come back as they have plenty of options for the pickiest of person's.
Norma is by far the best server I've EVER HAD ! Foods great fast friendly service keep coming back and keep asking to be set in Norma's section.  She's awesome!!!!
Great place to have breakfast, I had chicken & waffles that I really enjoyed, truly recommend. Will definitely be back!

If you come here you won't be disappointed. There is something on the menu for everyone, whether you want breakfast, lunch or dinner. It is a great brunch place! I had the Tito bandito and it was a plentiful amount of food and was tasty. All servings are large and you will not go away hungry. Service was average. Would definitely come back and continue to try items off the large menu!

Only been for breakfast. Shannon took good care of us today with great suggestions. Love the breakfast!! Not so much a fan of the hash brown or breakfast potatoes but love America cheese on the omelets. Pancakes are a bit too thick for me liking but waffles are great! We will be back!

I came here with my family on Palm Sunday last week after church. It was super busy, but we were seated within 7 minutes. The lady at the front when you walk in, and the lady who served us were both very kind and accomodating. This location was lively, filled with families. The decatur and charleston location isn't as full of energy just because of the crowd which is mostly seniors or office workers. Their restroom here was clean, unlike the location on flamingo and maryland.
I ordered the Chicken Cutlets and Spinach Fettuccine Alfredo. It was mouth-watering and juicy, full of flavor but not too salty nor greasy. 

One thing though, there was a 1x1cm piece of plastic in my fettuccine. Please be careful.
Best specialty menu, with choice of soup, salad, and coffee or soft drink, and USDA Meat entry, plus homemade dessert! For 10 bucks! Great taste as well.

I haven't been to a Blueberry Hill in about 8 years, and after our visit on Sunday, I'm really not sure why we have waited so long to go back.  

We decided to start the New Year off right, with a delicious breakfast with friends.  
We arrived at about 10am, right before the big rush.  There was no wait. 

The restaurant has a huge waiting area right up front.  Probably the biggest waiting area I've seen since Mimi's Café.  
Its well lit, and very clean.  

Our server was phenomenal.  I really wish I'd jotted down her name.  She was friendly.  Prompt. Super nice.  She double checked our orders, and kept our coffee cups full.  
Shall I mention the PLETHORA of flavored creamers she brought out for us?  I've never had a place bring so many before, and I use a lot, so this was perfect.

I know its odd, but I love the mugs that they served the coffee in.  I have a thing for mugs, and there's just something comforting about a big, thick, sturdy mug.  They have them for sale here, and I just might have to come back and buy one.  

The food was really good too.  
My fella and I ordered: 
The Eggs Benedict Florentine (Eggs Benedict with no Canadian bacon, with mushrooms and spinach) with a side of potato pancakes instead of regular potatoes or fruit. (Small upcharge.  Totally worth it.)
The Waitress Special:  an 8 oz ham steak with 2 eggs (over medium for hubby) and a Belgian waffle.  

I didn't try my husband's eggs and ham, as I REALLY dislike ham.  He loved it though.  I did, however, steal a bite of his waffle, and it was absolute perfection.  

MY meal was delicious.  I absolutely adore eggs benedict, and I only get to eat it maybe twice a year.  The eggs were poached perfectly.  The hollandaise was creamy and delightful, and everything was seasoned well.   
My potato pancakes were delightful.  Served with sour cream and applesauce, they were light and delicate.  A touch underseasoned, but I'd rather they be underseasoned than over.  They were spectacular.  

I definitely plan to go back again.  And this time, I won't wait for 8 years.

If I could give today's service ZERO stars I definitely would.  At the end, the manager took care of the bill but that doesn't justify today's service at all. I was served a drink out of a used cup, lipstick and all. It wasn't until I was finished with my meal that I realized the cup was gross. My fiancé specifically asked how does the chili come. She says: with onions and cheese if you'd like. My fiancé tells her No. she brings the chili out and theirs onions mixed in the chili. It's like dang, I specifically asked if this had onions in it and you told me no. You served me a cold meal. It just was not good experience at all. I've been to one other location twice, both were wonderful. That server needs to be retrained in "attention to detail" thinking about drinking out of a used cup from a complete stranger had me bawling when I left. (two thumbs down)

Yaaassss for better than IHOP combo meals on Sunday mornings when I'm visiting family Las Vegas. You can't go wrong with any of the breakfast meals, but I'm not too fond of the lunch or dinner meals. Prices are great as well! Please make sure you have the biscuit with butter- it's a meal in itself.

Nothing like a really well made breakfast to start off the day. This is my second visit and I am thrilled to be here! The menu choices are phenomenal and the ingredients are super fresh. This place does homemade and from scratch with excellence. Friendly staff, too! Today I'm having Potato Pancake Eggs Benedict - so, so good!

Items Selected:
Bottomless Coffee
Warm Blueberry Muffin
Honey Coconut Chicken and Waffles - Honey Coconut Hand Battered Chicken Breast, Butter Cream Waffle drizzled with Honey, Honey butter
Chocolate Chip Pancakes - Chocolate Chip Studded Chocolate Buttermilk Pancakes with Whipped Cream
Carrot Cake
Blueberry Crumb Cake

Newly opened in a renovated Marie Callender's on West Flamingo near Yonaka, it was in forgoing one last stop at The Griddle Café that I entered the newest location of family owned local favorite Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant, and with service as friendly and efficient as ever it was a five-part order that constituted breakfast as well as later-day snacks - some items absolutely delicious, while others decidedly lacked.

Located on a busy corner, with a parking lot nearly filled to capacity by 9:00am though the enormous restaurant was only perhaps 2/3 full, it was with the first of several cups of 100% Arabica coffee that the meal began and with bold flavor and a smooth finish one must say this is an area where Blueberry Hill excels, a statement no less justified in describing the 'limited' run of Blueberry Muffins, baked fresh each day and served warm with a streusel top and sidecar of butter, quick to sell out and "gone when they're gone."

Having sampled the Monte Cristo and Oreo Pancakes on a prior visit to the Decatur location it was once again in two entrees that appetite was invested and with a rich buttermilk recipe handed down since 1966 the supple texture of a 3-stack of pancakes was only improved by smooth whipped cream and a handful of melting chocolate chips, a chocolate fudge drizzle requested in place of the included syrup making things all the more decadent at absolutely no additional charge.

Moving next to something somewhat savory, suffice it to say that Blueberry Hill's Chicken and Waffles is nothing like that which one will find down South, yet having watched a young line-cook hand batter each strip in the kitchen, roll it in coconuts, and then toss it in a fryer the attention to detail was appreciated as each piping hot piece paired nicely to a pliable golden waffle well suited to soak up a drizzle of honey and plenty of butter soaked in the same.

At this point happily sated, but with a long wait at the car dealership ahead, it was with two slices of cake made in the on-site bakery that I took my leave and although the carrot cake was dry, spongy, and almost entirely devoid of flavor aside from sweetness from the cream cheese icing the Blueberry Crumb cake was a masterful composition with moist yellow cake, buttery crumbles, and bursting blueberries beneath bright blue frosting that tasted surprisingly natural, and not overly sweet.

A bit more expensive than chains such as IHOP, but obviously committed to using better ingredients and taking extra steps to assure customer satisfaction, Blueberry Hill remains one of Las Vegas' best 24/7 locally owned stops - the sort of place I'd probably never eat dinner, but one where breakfast is never a bad choice.

Open 24 hours!  Just like a NY diner.  Sadly this menu does not have 'disco fries' on their menu. However, try them by ordering fries with melted mozzarella and brown gravy;) 
My favorite server here in the AM is MARIA!

Great food and friendly service 
If you are looking for a good breakfast place that won't break the bank check this place out. It's not far from the strip, and was recommended to me by a LV locals.  French toast was done right- not too soggy and not too dry.  Waffle was delicious and corn beef hash was done just right.  They have a huge menu so there is a lot to choose from for everyone.  We'll be back again next time we are in Vegas.

Good Traditional American Food

My dad, my younger brother and I were hanging out at the office when I started nagging them about being hungry. To shut me up they asked a colleague to recommend a place nearby and that's how we ended up at Blueberry Hill.

I ordered me bacon, eggs and coffee which hit the spot for me, but sadly I was so busy licking up my own plate that I did not even get a chance to ask my father and brother if they liked their meals! Oh well, maybe next time I won't be so self-centered!
I had my food delivered and wow it was fantastic! It was hot and delicious! Will definitely order from them again!

We've been coming to this Blueberry Hill since we moved to Las Vegas. The food is excellent quality and the portions are far from stingy. All of the staff are very friendly. This is easily the best part of coming to this restaurant. The waitstaff ensures that your desires are met, and they do it with a smile. I need to personally shout out to Sara and Chantel! While I don't know them personally, they always remember us and greet us as if we're friends, as do several of the others. We always feel welcome here. The menu is versatile, and served at all hours. Pricing is also inexpensive. This restaurant is well worth a visit.

I would give 5 Stars if it wasn't for the fact that it took forever to get the food but that wasn't a waitresses fault and you could tell she was a little stressed trying to do her job to the best of her ability the food was amazing she was amazing thumbs up
Had the biscuits and gravy with eggs and bacon. They gave a very generous portion and the biscuit and eggs were delicious. The bacon was really greasy, though, so I didn't finish that.

I give this place 2.5 stars really. In kinda neutral about it. They have a very large breakfast menu and if you aren't from Las Vegas this may be a place that you will lo ve to eat at but for me it wasn't worth the hype. I don't eat pork so it limits my breakfast options but when i went in i had the the chicken and waffles which was VERY disappointing. The waffle was good but the meat was horrible,  I don't even think i can honestly call it chicken, it was bland, and chewy i was actually scared to eat it. But I do give the manager credit because they noticed that I did not eat it and only charged me for a waffle. I don't think I will ever go back to eat at a Blueberry Hill just isn't the place for me.

Stop by on a recent trip to Vegas

I found the food better than the national chains for breakfast.  

Fluffy pancakes
well cooked eggs, etc
decent customer service - waitress kept trying to move me to a set of sides

Also - the search for the perfect Corned beef hash continues......this place is strait out of a can
(boooo, and let shame be heaped upon you!)

This place had slow service.  
The pancakes are really fluffy and one of the better pancake places.
The Monte cristo sandwich was Like 2 stars it is not deep fried with the battered.  It didn't have enough taste for my buds.
Refills were slow.

I have been to a different blueberry hills location and it was a great expierence there. I brought my family to this location because it was close to the strip and we were hungry. I should have known this was going to be bad just from the fact there was not many people inside. The plates were dirty, the cups were dirty, the coffee was cold, abd and the server was rude and, apologies, incompetent. She did not get my husbands order right and never informed us that she had to have another burger made because it had been dropped supposedly. Needless to say it was ridiculous that we had to wait for his order.  Won't come back here and won't recommend it.

We stumbled upon this place walking from our hotel. It was around noon in the middle of the week. Our waitress was probably the best I've ever had. So sweet, so informative, so patient (I'm indecisive and the menu is huge) so attentive and so funny. The portions were huge! And the food was fantastic!

This place brings back memories from my childhood. DELICIOUS!!!! Had the cinnamon swirl pancakes and they're seriously to die for. Hubby had the biscuits and gravy and it was great. Gravy wasn't too salty it was perfect and biscuits soft and flaky. I highly recommend!!! Service is pretty good, they're constantly topping off coffee!

Excellent food, at least breakfast is consistent, fresh and fast. We've had several opportunities to try different menu items and consider all the food good. 

Today I had the Wild West omelette, served open faced with hash browns and toast.  If it is meat and cheese you crave, this is it, lots of diced ham and cheddar! 

My husband got the dealers special, eggs scrambled, choice of meat, he gets the ham steak, hash browns and toast. The ham steak is a generous portion, grilled and smoked. 

Because we both love pancakes, we added the cinnamon pancakes! The are so good. The cakes are light and fluffy, sprinkled in cinnamon and drizzled with a powder sugar icing. Just enough sugar to put you in a coma for the rest of the day!

Our server today is Maria, we often have her and she is always on it, brings us refills, often remembering our drink orders even before we sit down! As always, service is great, friendly and fast. 

If you want homemade desserts, they also have many pies and cakes to choose from.  I've had a slice of their cakes, one day, I'll order a whole cake, perhaps the orange cake, or maybe the chocolate, or the ... oh, so many to pick from.

If you have not ever been here, you are truly missing out! You get excellent food and great service! The waiters are nicer than the girls...sorry! We met the manager and he was a sweetheart! Gonna go next Saturday for mom birthday. Come join us!!! We are a hoot! California Okies!!!
Good food but I wish the place was a little cleaner the staff is super friendly very good price and you can come in here anytime

Our favorite place to eat. My favorite plates are the chilaquiles verdes and the Tennessee fried steak. Great food and great service. On this visit I did encounter a dirty coffee cup so I think they need to check a little bit more carefully when they put the cups out. Other than that I really love the food.

I had been searching for a good breakfast restaurant that had crepes on their menu. I had initially tried going to Cracker Barrel restaurant. BOY ! Am I glad I found this restaurant. I ordered the full house breakfast plate. I am in love! I just wished that this restaurant chain would exist in California. There are A LOT! Of breakfast choices. They are all GREAT. I know now where I will be bringing my family to have an excellent breakfast. The staff friendliness also makes it for a better experience
Great people, great food with exceptional service. You can't go wrong with this choice.

I had the same experience as another of your reviewers. Came in for lunch,  sat waiting for a server for more than 10 minutes. Finally a server came and said she'd try to find my server. Waited another 10 minutes and the same woman came back and sighed and said she'd go ahead and take my order.

Food was tasty, but the only time my server came by to check on me was to take my payment so she could go off shift. From then on I was on my own.

I'll give them another chance since the food is good and they're so close to where I live. But I was really disapointed at the lack of service.
The food was great and reasonably priced, especially if you are considering the Strip prices, and the service was very good too. I will return next time we are in Vegas.

My favorite location! I've been to 2 other locations and this one is the best. Breakfast was delicious! The bacon was actually cooked proper and was delicious. Biscuits and gravy, eggs, hash browns were all great! Thank you Blueberry Hill. Oh yeah, coffee was perfect as well! We will be back!
The best place on a drunken night! Loooove the ladies here! So sweet they are and the food is BOMB! Always love their HOT blueberry pancakes.

This place was packed for the hour we waited and finally slowed down when we left around 1:30. We met at 11:30 there. The portions are just crazy. You get a lot and then if you think a large plate wasn't enough they top it with a muffin or the delicious pancakes. After I ate almost the entire breakfast I was full until well into the night and when your in Vegas you just miss out on all the other buffets and restaurants. Make it a must stop for breakfast

This place was horrible. The kids meal burger is the same as the regular burger. They charge 3 dollars more for a slice of lettuce and a slice of tomatoes. The meat looked like it was cooked yesterday and it took 45 Mins to get out food. They got the order wrong for the French fries them took another 20 mins to bring the right fries. I would defiantly not recommend this to anyone . Save your money and cook at home.
Pancakes and waffles were fluffy and tasty! Hardly needed syrup. We will be going back for sure.
The meatloaf and Turkey was awful. The older waitresses argued while our food stood on the counter getting cold.

My favorite breakfast place and my comfort zone. I always drop by right here to get food before I work. Not a fan of their pancakes but other menu and pastries are absolutely amazing. I love how servers are very friendly and accomodating. Definitely suggest it to my friends. Hoping to keep up their friendly long time business :)

If you come on weekdays, you'll probably have a good experience, weekends not so much (since they are usually understaffed and there is one waitress that is less that friendly). Food is decent if not better than other breakfast places out there. Get the Truck Stop meatloaf special, the crepes, or any variety of pancakes. You can't go wrong. Location is where the old Marie Callendars once was. I like this place as a weekday destination. 

One thing I find very strange is that they NEVER give you a receipt when you pay with cash. If you ask for a receipt they have to go in the back to make one up for you. Why don't they have cash registers that can print out receipts for cash paying customers? Why the hassle? I find that odd.

My mom, dad,  and grandma accompanied me here for breakfast this morning and the food was delicious as always! 
The pancakes were big and fluffy and the corned beef was great as always. 
My mom enjoyed her French toast and my dad and I loved our omelets (which, by the way,  are huge!!).

Our server was very friendly and made sure our drinks were always filled and we had everyrhign we needed.
Love this family style restaurant! You can get anything here!  Staff is friendly, service is fast.... Food is average, but good.  Price is also very reasonable!

The menu here is daunting. So much breakfast dishes I want to try.  It was a hard selection. The waitress, Barbara, raved about the biscuits. However, I went with the crepes because it just sounded ridiculous... it was ridiculous.  Food coma.... Zzzzzzz

Service was great.
Coffee was okay.

So we pull into the former Marie Callendars last night and thought we'd give this place a try as we hadn't had breakfast for dinner in quite some time. Well after sitting in a dirty dusty booth I immediately regretted my decision but my kid said mom come on don't be like that. 

Anyhow we ordered cheese stuff French toast with fruit and the Triple 4.  

First off their sausage links for charging more then a Denny's or IHOP which I never go to , are disgusting.  There is no meaty quality they are soft , mushy and a slight grayish color.  The bacon thin crispy salty of low quality and he eggs were just whatever.

Well my spikey red haired waitress I called her over to show her my pancake was pure batter in the middle and she takes my whole plate with eggs and all on it back to the kitchen I was absolutely shocked , disgusted and puzzled.  Wtf you see the pancake is messed up ! Wtf why did you take my whole plate with my food to the back then bring it back out had me scrape my food and take the batter pancake back? Made absolutely zero sense 

So she has two more pancakes made without even asking me what I wanted to do. The biting of the battery pancake was revolting and left me feeling putrid all night  

She then says "O honey I understand I'm not mad at you" are you freakin kidding me ? Mad at me ? For what for being victim for your over priced horrid food.  I have half the mind to call the health department because I guarantee things need to be cleaned up back there 


I quickly threw cash on the table and bolted out taking the two freshly made pancakes with us.  We have them to a homeless guy closer towards Decatur. 

Seriously Denny or iHop has much better quality food and service.  How about next time your client goes chomping unknowingly on a uncooked pancake leaving a batter disgusting mess in their mouth you don't make them pay for that crap. I'm still upset this morning and I feel sick now.  

That French toast thing the cream cheese on the inside was lumpy and tasteless and the whole toast was covered in powdered sugar   Icing I ate it just to get the damn moment of the pancake out of my mouth and I'm regretting it over and over now. 

You will get better quality meat and eggs anywhere  se McDonald's Burger King anywhere.  You tourists who want breakfast and don't go here go to a casino where the food is good quality and the servers actually know how to treat customers and amped situations and have customer service not just thirsty for a higher tip.  


I had such a moronic waitress I'm really going to give them a mouthful today ! 

The corporate office said they were going to refund my money but here we are almost two weeks later and nothing. Thanks for the lies

Horrible just horrible. Wish I could give no stars. Definitely NOT up to Blueberry hill standards. The server is the ONLY thing Positive. Tammy was friendly but when her crew can't back her up she can't do her job. Spoke to manager about these issues didn't seem to really care. He said the right things but ga e me the right right right and pushed me along.
Best French toast ever!  Love the combo omelet with salsa!  Great Place.  Enjoyed our server.

Food is good. 
Service can be a little better. Always feel like I have to chase a server down for a refill or extra napkins.

Would rate 0 if I could! Went there this morning for breakfast with family! Our waitress Tammy was very rude and had an attitude like she was mad at the world! My wife's eggs, potatoes and bacon tasted like they were cooked in old oil that was used to cook skunk before! The manager did take her breakfast off our bill! As we left(without leaving a tip) we saw Tammy pointing at us and talking to another waitress! Maybe Tammy didn't like the fact that I was carrying my gun, which is perfectly legal! Never had such a problem in other Blueberry Hill locations! We won't be back!

This place was recommended to us by our Airbnb host and it was super good. I decided to pull a "when in Vegas" and got their Oreo pancakes. Oh my goodness, SO MUCH PANCAKE but so worth it. The waitress was really nice and it was a very comfortable atmosphere. If you're looking for a family friendly place to eat breakfast (or any meal of the day), definitely give this place a try.

This place is nothing like the one one decatur. Decatur is great because it has history. I like the environment and the food was great. It had a wedding going on that night I went. Overall good experience.

We were looking for a good breakfast place near the strip without either paying $1000 for breakfast or getting ebola from a buffet.  Thank you Yelp for helping us find this little gem.  The service was great, the food was great, and the location was awesome and near the strip.  We would definitely go back next time we are in Vegas.
Great service. Denver Omelette was so good. Donald was great with his service. A must go to place if you want exceptional food and service.

Food is really good, but the service is terrible. How do you schedule 1 server? Even though she has 4 tables in the restaurant she is clearly overwhelmed. Waited 5 mins to be sat and another 15 to be greeted. Server had a very condescending attitude about her, I will not mention names!

I stopped in here twice for breakfast over the CES 2017 week in January.

Both times we were greeted by the lovely staff members and sat in the seats that we requested (once at the bar and once at a table with access to a power outlet).

The food is great and has that 'home cooked' feel to it.  Portions are HUGE so bear that in mind.  Both times we ordered different dishes and we said, we should have split everything.

Overall I am a fan and would recommend to anyone who wants a decent meal in a 'familiar' environment.  Get here early on the weekends though.  When we left on Saturday around 10am there were a number of groups waiting to be seated.

I really enjoyed my experience at this location that is closer to my condo. We visited on Christmas night and we each ordered the Holiday special. 

I ordered the classic turkey dinner which was $12.99 for a complete turkey dinner which included, soup or salad, drink and any dessert! The sage stuffing was delicious and the gravy was so tasty! They really packed on the turkey which was tender along with stuffing, mashed taters and corn.

My guest ordered the cherry glazed Ham dinner which included, soup or salad, drink and any dessert for $12.99.

This was a lot of food and both of our meals were delicious! This was a Holiday special keep in mind however I would make a visit even if not a holiday to have a turkey dinner which is always on their menu!

I really enjoyed this new location as it was clean, bright and comfortable.

The dessert counter looks Amazing as you walk in the front door. The hardest part was deciding on what dessert to order at the end which we asked them to pack up to go.

We will be back for sure to enjoy a nice restaurant meal and experience!

One of the best breakfast places I've ever been to. Good enough to make me write my first yelp review. The Four Cheese French Toast, Wild West Omelet with Spinach and no meat, Belgium Waffles, and even the Sourdough toast left us speechless. Friendly service as well. Highly recommend

This was our first time dining here it was about 10:30pm it wasn't to busy maybe about 3-4 tables including us our server didn't seem to happy to have to be working for what ever reason but hey no one is always happy 100%of the time but hey at least put a grin at least lol anyways the food here is on point well def be back

Skip the buffet and HIGH priced restaurants in the hotels and on the strip. This place was awesome and will be the only place we will eat in Vegas. Huge plates full of food for breakfast and dinner. .  Super staff and awesome desserts

Huge portions!

The prices are a bit high, IMO, but considering the quality of the food and the amount of food, the prices are not too unreasonable.

I went with my mom and my two year old.  The 3 of us shared a Spinach and Mushroom Omelette and we didn't even finish all of our breakfast.  Omelettes are made with 4 eggs and come with your choice of side (3 homemade buttermilk pancakes, 2 wedges of french toast, or hashbrowns and toast).  We opted for the 3 buttermilk pancakes.  They were delicious,  thick, fluffy, and great flavor.  I was impressed that they were served with real butter and it was whipped.  Nice!  Also, the syrup comes to the table warm in a syrup dispenser (no cold syrup from a single serve pack).  

The omelette was good, nothing too special, but good.

We told our waitress we were sharing and she was very accommodating and brought us extra plates.  We asked for more butter and she brought us a large portions of that glorious whipped real butter.

Went again with the husband and baby and I ordered the Ham and Cheese Omelette with pancakes.  Omelette was cheesy and tasty.  Pancakes were still delicious.  Again, asked for more butter and got a huge dollop of real butter (the pancakes probably come with plenty of butter but I like A LOT of butter, especially when it is real and whipped).  

My husband ordered the Blueberry's Meat Lover's Skillet.  He loved it (and he is not afraid to let me know when he thinks something is not so bueno).  He said it had tons of meat, but not too much, and the pieces of meat were large and great quality.  He had plenty to bring home and had it the next day from breakfast and still did not finish it!

Both times our servers were extremely friendly, courteous, and attentive.  The ambience is nice and they had sports on the tv's through out the restaurant.  It reminds me a bit of a Mimi's Cafe or Marie Calendar's, as far as style, but a small step up and much better food.  

Menu is huge with tons of variety.  There is something for everyone, anytime of day.  Oh, and the cakes in the front look amazing.

Staple place to visit. This place makes IHOP and Dennys look like fool. Service is basic nothing special but you don't find here for that. The pancakes are to die for get them you won't be disappointed. Not sure I'd order anything else but breakfast here this is what they are known for.

This is the newest Blueberry Hill. It opened up a little over a week ago on the corner of Flamingo and Decatur and replaced what used to be a Marie Callender's. 

They didn't change much as far as interior decor goes, but I am glad after quote a while of this location being vacant that there is a new restaurant in the area. Even better to have a new breakfast spot. 

On this occasion, my mom and I stuck to the dinner menu and they have several grand opening specials going on now. We opted for dinner entrees and received a free dessert. The menu is huge and after a long time of perusing I decided on the honey coconut chicken with a side of fries and green beans. I do not like canned veggies, so I avoided the green beans, but enjoyed the rest of my meal. The chicken was moist and not overly sweet like I was expecting. My mom enjoyed her pork chops and for dessert I ordered the carrot cake and my mom went with the blueberry pie. She enjoyed her, but I felt mine was a little dry for my taste. I took it home and my fella enjoyed it quite a bit, so it's more of a acquired taste.

I'm usually a fan of this chain's breakfasts, so I'll be back for that. They also have an enormous assortment of desserts to choose from that are all made in house. 

The food is nothing amazing, but it's solid and this location is a lot nicer than others in town.
Typical family dinner, nice place to go to get away from the higher priced strip places. Food was good and generous portions. So much better than our hotel buffet. Friendly staff.

I'm updating my review from the poor service last time. I absolutely love this place. The food has always been good, they have quite the extensive menu with different cuisines and they are all good. This morning I decided to be a badass and have several mimosas and breakfast sausage to get my day started right! My partner enjoyed his ham and hash browns. I'm always mesmerized by their cakes in their display cases and today is no exception. Their chocolate cream pie is to die for. I'm glad I came back, service was much better this this time!

This was our first time eating at Blueberry Hill & I can't say enough wonderful things about it. I had a grilled cheese & bacon w/ curly fries while my husband had pancakes w/ breakfast potatoes. The food was DELICIOUS, but the service was even better. Our server Felicia was so genuinely friendly and she made our day. You generally don't expect to have a trip to a restaurant brighten your day that much, but this was a very nice surprise. We look forward to eating here often & Felicia deserves a  raise.

Definitely a newer location than the other Blueberry Hills. Ordered the turkey BLT club and it's huge. I was stuffed after half the sandwich. It could have used some more mayo though, was a little dry. But the ingredients were good.  Service was friendly and attentive, establishment is clean.
